Som jurist hos oss får du möjligheten att delta i projekt tillsammans med hela Forefronts kompetensbas, allt från de skarpaste tekniska konsulterna till säkerhetsexperter, UX-designers och IT-strateger. Vi befinner oss ofta i projekt som gäller den nyaste tekniken, AI, cloudresor och digitala transformationer. Det som knyter oss samman är vår starka kultur och värderingar där *Tillsammans* genomsyrar allt vi gör.


Som juristkonsult på Forefront arbetar du i en platt organisation där din ambition, drivkraft och passion för våra olika arbetsområden väger tyngre än antal år i yrket. Forefront Legal Services består idag av sju jurister, var och en med sin specifika bakgrund, erfarenhet och expertis. Tillsammans erbjuder vi ett starkt och mångsidigt juridiskt stöd till våra kunder. Vi bidrar till varandras framgång och utveckling, både som individer och som grupp. Här får du, förutom chansen att djupdyka i juridiska frågeställningar i teknikens framkant, också möjlighet att engagera dig i affärsutveckling, försäljning, rekrytering och utbildning – allt som utgör vardagen i en framgångsrik konsultverksamhet.


**Så här beskriver rekryterande chef, Henrik Ulander, Legal Services verksamhet idag:**


*”Vår styrka är kombinationen av djup juridisk kunskap och erfarenhet tillsammans med förståelse för tekniken, dess möjligheter och utmaningar, samt en genuin affärsmässig förståelse för våra kunders verksamhet och specifika förutsättningar.*

*Vår ambition är att göra juridiken begriplig och användarvänlig genom tydliga lösningar som förenklar förståelse och beslutsfattande för våra kunder.*


*Vi sitter inte på kammaren och skriver långa rättsutredningar eller tar fram teoretiska PM som lämnas över till kunden för implementation på egen hand, så är det den typen av arbetsuppgifter du söker är vi förmodligen inte arbetsplatsen för dig. Reaktiva juridiska bromsklossar kommer du inte hitta som kollegor på Forefront.*


*Om du istället ser fördelarna med att jobba nära kunden med en pragmatisk hands on-approach och hantera varierande arbetsuppgifter på ett prestigelöst, lösningsorienterat och proaktivt sätt, och dessutom ha väldigt kul på jobbet, så har du förmodligen hittat rätt!”*

Kvalifikationer
**Är du vår kommande kollega?**



Om det du precis har läst väckt din nyfikenhet, så letar vi just nu efter fler konsulter med juristexamen eller affärsjuristexamen i grunden, gärna med olika profiler och erfarenheter, till vårt växande team.


Vi ser gärna att du har en inriktning mot IT-juridik med ett tydligt affärsjuridiskt fokus alternativt en bakgrund inom säkerhetsjuridiken och därtill hörande regelverk.



Vi erbjuder idag tjänster inom bl.a. IT-juridik, affärsjuridik och compliance och kan även agera extern juristfunktion åt våra kunder. Vår vision är att bli ett Tech Law Powerhouse!


**Exempel på områden där Legal Services hjälper våra kunder:**


* IT-avtal, IT-projekt och molntjänster
* AI-juridik
* Dataskydd, GDPR och cookies
* Compliance inom Legal Tech/Säkerhetsjuridik (NIS2, DORA, CER, CRA, Data Act etc)
* Legal Design
* Tvistlösning, särskilt avseende komplexa IT-avtal
* Kommersiell avtalsrätt och avtalsförhandlingar
* Inköpsjuridik (kravställning mot leverantörer, avtalsförhandling etc)
* Cyber-, IT- och informationssäkerhet


Vi ser med fördel att du har konsulterfarenhet inom ett eller flera av dessa områden.


**Om dig**



Vi ser gärna att du har en bakgrund inom konsultbranschen, från advokatbyrå eller motsvarande där du har fått erfarenhet av att driva uppdrag/projekt självständigt. Som konsult är du van att presentera business cases, rapporter och rekommendationer i det format som passar uppdraget och har därmed erfarenhet av hela MS-Officepaketet, i synnerhet PowerPoint, Word och Excel.


Du har utmärkta kunskaper i svenska och engelska, i såväl tal som skrift. Du har erfarenhet av att arbeta med olika delar av en verksamhet och klarar av att göra juridiken förståelig för icke-jurister.



Som person är du pragmatisk, analytisk, nyfiken och ansvarstagande. Vi är övertygade om att du har ett kommersiellt mindset och förstår att juridiken måste sättas in i ett affärssammanhang och inte lever sitt eget liv.


**Om rekryteringsprocessen**  

Har du frågor kring tjänsten eller rekryteringsprocessen, tveka inte att kontakta Head of Legal Services, Henrik Ulander, , 073-923 15 78 eller ansvarig rekryterare Anna Gestblom Bottner, , 072-242 49 49.


Nyfiken på att läsa mer om hur vi tänker kring juridiken på Forefront? Klicka in på


Välkommen till Forefront Legal Services, vi ser fram emot din ansökan!



Om företaget
Forefront Consulting är ett verksamhets- och IT-konsultbolag med drygt 500 anställda. Med kontor på åtta orter i Sverige, guidar vi företag och organisationer i det digitala landskapet och övriga transformationer.



Oavsett om uppdraget avser affärsverksamhet, teknologiska plattformar eller designlösningar är utgångspunkten alltid att först skapa en samsyn kring nödvändiga förändringar för att sedan kunna realisera dessa på bästa sätt för avsedd effekt.


.Våra värderingar är vårt DNA


AvsiktAvsikten är motorn i vårt arbete och medvetenheten om var målet ligger. Den ger oss styrkan att ifrågasätta det till synes uppenbara, lägger kraft bakom våra påståenden och motiverar våra beslut.


AvtryckAvtryck säger något om vår starka ambition att skapa förändring. Att göra verklig skillnad. Både i aktuella kundprojekt och i vår omvärld i stort. Vi är stolta över att våra kunder talar väl om oss. Och vi blir glada när vår verksamhet ses som en positiv förebild av kollegorna i branschen.


InsiktDet är i insikten som vårt arbete börjar. För att nå dit krävs tålamod, empati och ödmjukhet, samt nyfikenhet nog att kunna ta in flera olika perspektiv och väga samman informationen. Insikt handlar om att verkligen förstå problemet innan vi försöker lösa det.


TillsammansTillsammans är den väg vi väljer för att nå de mål vi siktar mot. Ordet ger uttryck för vårt sökande efter mervärdet i en gemensam strävan. Det handlar om att befinna sig jämsides med kunder och kollegor. Utan prestige och onödiga hierarkier, men med delaktighet, ansvar och arbetsglädje.


UtsiktUtsikt beskriver både en position och den medvetna ansträngning som är nödvändig för att ta sig dit. Begreppet påminner oss också om att goda rådgivare är öppna och ödmjuka. Det handlar om att se och att särskilja, med fokus på kundens affärsnytta.


Om företaget
Forefront Consulting är ett verksamhets- och IT-konsultbolag med drygt 500 anställda. Med kontor på åtta orter i Sverige, guidar vi företag och organisationer i det digitala landskapet och övriga transformationer.



Oavsett om uppdraget avser affärsverksamhet, teknologiska plattformar eller designlösningar är utgångspunkten alltid att först skapa en samsyn kring nödvändiga förändringar för att sedan kunna realisera dessa på bästa sätt för avsedd effekt.
company_description: Forefront builds a vibrant social impact sector for all people of Illinois.

title: Senior Product Designer
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us— and let the world feel your work.**

**The role**


As a Senior Product Designer at Epidemic Sound, you'll play a key role in shaping our user experience. Your creative ideas and strategic thinking will drive the development of our digital product offering that delights our customers and elevates our brand.


Collaborating closely with designers, product managers, analysts, developers, and leadership, you'll help build and ship intuitive, visually appealing products that meet both user needs and business objectives.  

  

**Your key responsibilities include:**

  

* Own the user experience and design output for your product team, ensuring high-quality results
* Lead end-to-end design processes, driving excellent outcomes for prioritized initiatives
* Identify UX gaps and opportunities, shaping strategic improvements
* Influence product strategy by leading visioning and user experience planning
* Foster a culture of design sharing, feedback, and critique within the team
* Contribute to the evolution of design systems, patterns, and standards, ensuring consistency and scalability across platforms
* 

**Requirements:**

* Strong craft skills in user experience and digital user interface design
* Excellent communication, presentation and storytelling skills
* In depth knowledge of established UX and UI patterns
* In depth knowledge in applying design processes and methods to effectively take lead on complex key initiatives
* In depth knowledge in planning, conducting and synthesizing user research
* In depth knowledge of understanding and following up on data and analytics
* Knowledge in how to effectively manage stakeholder relationships to influence others and lead change
* 

**Soft skills**

* + Ability to inspire and lead through excellent design craftsmanship
	+ Positive, constructive attitude that energizes and motivates others
	+ Clear, effective communication of ideas and justification for design decisions

**Equal opportunity employer**


We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.

**Application**


Ready to make the world feel your work? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link “interested” below.

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
**What we are looking for**


We are searching for a senior UX designer that will work for our client based in Gothenburg. This position will be part of a team, which empowers users through an online experience that drives informed purchasing decisions by seamlessly connecting educational content with inspiration.

**What you will do**


As a Senior UX Designer within the team, you'll develop a deep understanding of the customers' needs and pain points, serving as an expert for your product team. You'll use these insights to create elegant solutions that address customer needs. Your primary responsibility will be delivering end-to-end user experience design artifacts - from usability testing and user flows to stories, wireframes, and prototypes - that balance design aesthetics with intuitive functionality throughout the discovery and delivery process.


You will work closely with user-researchers, fellow designers, developers, and other experts to test critical assumptions, gathering valuable data and create delightful experiences for existing and becoming customers. As a UX designer you will also be an internal thought-leader on user experience best practices and trends.

**Who you are**

* You’ve been designing for 6+ years for a consumer-focused tech company, so you understand what it takes to create elegant, consumer-oriented experiences.
* You are a versatile designer who uses a full range of skills - product design, interaction design, and visual design - to ensure you deliver magical experiences to the customer.
* You’re a strong communicator. Who can inspire teams towards action and empathy for the user.
* You are a strong collaborator, who can work with not only design patterns, but many other stakeholders from marketing to engineering.
* You have a people-focused design mentality. Constantly looking to hone your design instinct through user feedback. Whether that’s hands-on user research or a quantitative A/B test.
* You are fluent in English

**Application process**

  

Selection is ongoing, and the position may be filled before the application deadline. Therefore, submit your application today! If you have any questions regarding the recruitment process, please contact the responsible recruiter Andrea Dalen, via email andrea.dalen@skill.se

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
At
 **Hive Streaming,** 
 we empower some of the world’s most inspiring companies to deliver high-quality internal video communications that boost engagement and align teams. With over 100 patents, our innovative next-generation technology continues to push the boundaries of digital employee experience.
   

  

 The Hive
 **Video Experience (VX) Platform** 
 revolutionizes internal video communication by empowering event production teams with the ability to ensure perfect video experiences for all employees—from proactive testing to real-time troubleshooting, optimization, and post-event analytics.
   

  

**Your Mission**
 Hive Streaming is growing its Product Team and we are looking for a new
 **UX/UI Designer** 
 to join us from our Stockholm office. You will be part of a small but skilled UX team, and together, you will work closely with the Product Owners and developers to make sure we deliver the best experience to our customers. You will be part of our hybrid workplace, which means you can choose to work remotely or at our office (to enjoy a free massage, team-building activities, and more).
   

  

**What you’ll do as a UX/UI Designer at Hive**
 First of all, you will be working on very cool niche products, creating digital tools for professional use, and serving some of the world's largest enterprises. You will participate in the whole spectrum of UX and UI design, improving existing products and creating new ones. You will team up with a product owner, an engineering manager, and a full product development team.
   

  

 You will also be in close collaboration with the other members of the UX team, bouncing design ideas, managing our design system, to ensure consistency across products, and evolving our product design processes and practices. We will also be shaping our processes and tools for gaining insights about how our customers use our products and how they can be improved.
   

  

 If you enjoy working across the entire UX and UI lifecycle, this is a fantastic opportunity!
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
* At least a few years experience working with UX/UI
* Experience in designing advanced digital tools
* An education within the relevant field
* A strong analytical mind, capable of understanding complex problem domains, and structuring complex problems
* The ability to communicate regarding design with various stakeholders
* Knowledge in accessibility (WCAG/ADA)
* Created/maintained a design system
* Basic knowledge in analyzing usage statistics
* You are fluent in professional English
* Preferably a portfolio you can submit with your application


**Nice To Have**
* Experience working with a SaaS product
* Experience from continuous improvement of an existing digital service
* Experience in setting up/defining a framework for analyzing usage statistics
* Competence in UX-writing


**What Makes You a Perfect Match**
* A daring innovator, eager to test and evaluate new solutions.
* A team player who collaborates effectively and builds on ideas.
* A customer-centric designer who exceeds user expectations.
* A problem solver who thrives on challenges and delivers effective solutions.
* A clear communicator who listens first and then seeks to be understood.
* A results-oriented professional who works smartly to achieve goals.


 We hope you resonate with Hive’s core values of
 **Customer Centricity, Innovation, and Empowerment** 
 and that you can be a culture add to our diverse global team of 80 employees, representing over 20 different nationalities. 🐶
 **Bonus:** 
 Our Stockholm office is dog-friendly!

title: Senior Designer
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us— and let the world feel your work.**
 As a
 **Senior Designer** 
 at Epidemic Sound, you will play a pivotal role in designing and executing creative concepts across various platforms. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to deliver visually impactful design solutions from concept to final production.
   

  

**Your key responsibilities include:**
* Leading the development and execution of design concepts across digital, print, and experiential media.
* Collaborating with internal teams to understand project goals and ensure designs
* align with creative vision and business objectives.
* Managing design projects from start to finish, overseeing timelines and production.
* Providing mentorship and guidance to junior designers and third-party producers.
* Acting as a brand advocate, ensuring all designs reflect Epidemic Sound’s visual identity.


**Requirements:**
* 5+ years of relevant experience.
* Portfolio showcasing a wide range of design skills.
* Working experience within the Adobe Suite.
* Strong aptitude in design principles (form, color, typography, layout).
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
* Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.
* Proactive and solution-oriented approach.
* Strong attention to detail and a passion for design excellence.


**Equal opportunity employer**
 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
   

  

**Application**
 Ready to make the world feel your work? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link “interested” below.
   

  

**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.**

title: CPO
description:
Mentimeter is an engagement tool with a clear goal in mind. To turn presentations into conversations. Through real-time interactivity and clear visualizations, we get people to participate, engage and become more productive. Transforming all those passive meetings, airless classrooms and drawn out trainings into valuable and memorable moments.
   

  

 We truly believe that you achieve the best results by doing things together. And that successful leaders need to adopt a curious and collaborative mindset in order to get there. So with you at Mentimeter, you’ll be a big part of the ambition to help over 1 billion people listen, learn and work better together.
   

  

 As
 **Chief Product Officer (CPO)** 
 , you will play a pivotal role in shaping our product vision, driving innovation, and leading the Product Department through an exciting period of growth. Your responsibility together with the management team is to continue keeping Menti an innovate and fast growing company, ensuring we unlock the power of together for over 1 billion people. You will report to the CEO, be part of the Menti management team as well as lead the Product Department management team.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
**Strategic Leadership**
* Define and communicate the overarching product vision and strategy to align with company goals and market opportunities.
* Stay ahead of market trends, customer needs, and technological advancements to drive product innovation.
* Work closely with the Mentimeter Management Team, including the Revenue Trio (CPO, CMO, CSO), to align product strategy with business and revenue objectives.
* Lead Mentimeter's transformation into a multi-product company, including customer understanding, market opportunities, and execution capability.


**Product Department Leadership**
* Lead, mentor, and inspire the Product Department Management Team to create a culture of collaboration, openness, innovation, and continuous improvement.
* Develop and execute a talent strategy to attract, retain, and grow top talent across Engineering, Product Management, and Design.
* Ensure seamless cross-functional collaboration between departments, particularly with Marketing and Sales.


**Product Development and Execution**
* Oversee the full product lifecycle, from ideation to launch and optimization, ensuring high-quality and timely delivery.
* Prioritize product initiatives based on strategic importance, customer impact, and ROI.
* Implement and refine processes to enhance efficiency, speed, and quality in product development.
* Be decisive and effective in decision-making and execution.


**Revenue Responsibility, Performance Management, and Metrics**
* Drive revenue growth for Self-Service and support Enterprise revenue in collaboration with the Chief Sales Officer.
* Define, track, and improve product performance metrics to measure success and identify opportunities.
* Align product efforts with key metrics for the customer journey, such as PQL and PQA.
* Regularly report on product performance to the executive team and board, providing insights and recommendations for growth.
* Foster a culture of data-driven decision-making within the Product Department.


**Customer and Market Focus**
* Advocate for customer needs throughout the product development process, ensuring that feedback informs product decisions.
* Lead efforts to gather and analyze market data, customer insights, and competitive intelligence to inform strategy.
* Collaborate with Sales, Marketing, and Customer Success teams to ensure product-market fit and strong go-to-market strategies.


**Technology and Design Excellence**
* Promote best practices in software engineering, UX/UI design, research, and agile methodologies within the Product Department Leadership Team.
* Ensure scalable, user-friendly, and robust products through technical excellence.


**Qualifications**
* Proven experience in leading product teams as a CPO, VP of Product, or similar role in a B2B SaaS environment (10+ years).
* Demonstrated ability to build and scale products, from concept to execution, driving growth and revenue.
* Skilled in leading in high-complexity environments, managing ambiguity, and empowering teams to innovate and adapt.
* Strong expertise in at least one craft: Engineering, Product Management, or Design.
* Technically curious and interested in AI-driven product development.
* Exceptional leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to inspire and influence across all levels of the organization.
* Proven ability to hire, develop, and retain top talent, building a culture of engagement and high performance.
* Deep understanding of the SaaS business model, enterprise customer needs, and technology trends.
* A passion for innovation and delivering exceptional user experiences.


**What you will have to support you in your responsibilities:**
* You will be part of Menti Management team that together has the responsibility to make Menti successful
* You will be part of Product Department Management Team where you will decide on which roles you need, to be a successful CPO
* A product department (engineers, designers and product managers) consisting of ca 120 brilliant people (with ca 50% in Engineering) & Product Data & Analytics consisting of 6 people


**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page.
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: Mobile iOS Developer
description:
Do you have a passion for mobile application development and IoT? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you. The Digital and Access Solutions (DAS) business segment within the EMEIA Division is looking for a Mobile iOS Developer to join the Wireless Lock product unit, based in Stockholm, Sweden. You'll be part of a collaborative culture that empowers you to build a career you can be proud of.
   

  

**What You Would Do As Our Mobile IOS Developer**
 You would develop applications for configuration and operations of our wireless locks and systems. You will join a cross functional agile software team with mobile and cloud developers, QAs and a UX designer. You will work closely with our firmware team regarding communication with the devices. On top of this you will cooperate with product management on the app requirements.
   

  

 You would also:
   

  

* Contribute to planning activities by analyzing requirements, make specifications and break down implementation work (epics and stories).
* Investigate and resolve customer-reported issues.
* Take part in end user testing activities.
* Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies.


**The Skills And Experience You Need**
 We are looking for someone who has:
   

  

* A minimum of 3 years of experience in iOS app development, mainly with Swift.
* Experience with RESTful APIs and integration with cloud services.
* Experience with git, continuous integration and delivery practices.
* Strong command of written and spoken English.
* Technical education in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or similar. Bachelor's degree or higher preferred.


 Ideally, you have experience working with several of the following – development of mobile applications for connected IoT devices, BLE communication, Swift UI, APIs for offline storage, threading and performance tuning, security technologies such as TLS, Keychain, MFA, OAuth and PKI, iOS development, cross platform languages such as React native (expo), Kotlin multi-platform or Flutter, SAFe agile methodology. I addition, you share our belief in lean and agile values, with an open mind set, cross-functional teams, where many competences are working together for successful projects.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We’re passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress a lifelong career with us – here’s what we have to offer:
   

  

* Learning and career development opportunities, whether it’s online learning, management training or enhancing your skills.
* A competitive salary and incentive schemes.
* The opportunity to grow your skills in a versatile way and develop your career in a respected global group.
* Agile and innovative working environment.
* Motivated and encouraging team around you.
* Stable employment in a friendly international atmosphere
* Hybrid working model with minimum of 2 office days per week


**We review applications regularly, so don't wait**
 We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us. Just set up your profile and apply here.
   

  

 To make sure your personal data is safe, we don’t look at any applications sent by email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the process, email Mona Yusefi, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at mona.yusefi@assaabloy.com.
   

  

 Depending on the risk profile for the role, a background screening will need to be performed. Final candidates may therefore be a subject to a background screening. The performance of a background check is subject to consent and based on our Applicant Privacy Notice.
   

  

 Let’s create a safer and more open world - together!
   

  

 To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 61,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Enterprise Solution Architect
description:
Join our Team
   

  

**About This Opportunity**
 Do you want to be part of a team designing the architecture for Ericsson’s digital transformation? At Ericsson, we've identified a set of digital capabilities tied together in different customer and employee journeys. We aim to improve our customers’ experience and end-to-end workflow efficiency by using data, new innovative ways of working, and fit-for-purpose modern technology.
   

  

 As an Enterprise Solution Architect you will work in an agile team and be responsible for the design and blueprinting architecture, realized by internal software engineers or external vendors. You would be responsible for continuously matching business requirements, aligned with perspectives from business process, information architecture, data architecture and IT architecture along with focus on the functionality aspects. You are entrusted with creating business value, by balancing the functional requirements against other non-functional/quality requirements, by evaluating necessary priorities and compromises, while defining the best fit solution.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Ensure alignment with our target architecture and security directives, ranging from integration patterns to buy/build recommendations, guiding and steering agile development teams with architecture guardrails and advice.
* Present solution architecture to formal review boards when applicable.
* Influence and share architectural good practices within Group IT and across Ericsson.
* Be working in close collaboration with Product Owners, Business Analysts, Data Scientists, Service designers, UX designers, Software Engineers, Business SME's, Agile Coaches etc. as well as peer architect roles including Enterprise-, Security-, Business- and Information Architects.
* Be an ambassador for enterprise architecture and an active contributor in internal and external architecture communities.


**Skills You Bring**
* An understanding of how to build and implement full-stack enterprise-grade web and mobile solutions (cloud native, containers, public cloud PaaS services, security built-in, API first design etc.) as well as integration with Commercial-off-the-shelf and Software-as-a-Service solutions.
* Ability to collaborate with a diverse team of people from different backgrounds, field of expertise, level of seniority across different parts of the world.
* A genuine interest in technology, eager to learn and keep up with the latest trends like AI/ML, automation and public cloud.
* Well versed with Enterprise Architecture Modelling tools (such as LeanIX, ARIS, Sparx, Archi, etc.)
* Knowledge of Enterprise Architecture frameworks (such as TOGAF, Zachman, etc.)
* An Agile and experimentation mindset – where you would take informed decision quickly, seek feedback actively and adjust decisively.


**Nice to have**
* A background designing digital solutions for either Supply & Logistics, Sourcing, Finance/ERP, Telecom Network Roll-out or customer journey workflows in a B2B scenario.
* Expertise in digital contract platforms (e.g., DocuSign, Adobe Sign, CLM).
* Experience with leading CPQ platforms (e.g., Salesforce CPQ, Oracle CPQ).
* Strong in Supply Chain Planning and Integrated Business Planning.
* Knowledge/experience in BMC Helix, SuccessFactors, SAP S/4 systems
* Knowledge of integration patterns, data management and workflow automation.


**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 We encourage you to consider applying to jobs where you might not meet all the criteria. We recognize that we all have transferrable skills, and we can support you with the skills that you need to develop.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 [[Sweden]] || [[Stockholm]]
   

  

**Primary Recruiter:** 
 [[Anitha Pulluru]]
   

  

**Hiring Manager:** 
 [[Khalid Cruz]]
   

  

 ]]>

title: Staff Machine Learning Engineer
description:
***This job is with EQT Group, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.***
*Our vision for EQT employees is to build high performing & engaged teams. Our competitive edge comes from fostering an environment where every individual feels valued, empowered, and motivated to drive business impact.
   

  

 Our commitment to inclusion is not just about fairness; We understand and believe that being a great place to work drives the best performance.
   

  

 At EQT, inclusion is a business imperative and it's embedded into our talent strategy, decision-making, and culture to ensure that every individual and team operates at their full potential. By doing so, we unlock better collaboration, stronger innovation, and superior investment outcomes*
 We are looking for a full-time Staff Machine Learning Engineer based in Stockholm to lead the AI team in Motherbrain. In this role you’ll join our Platform team, engaging with modern technologies and highly skilled colleagues.
   

  

 Our mission is to empower professionals with actionable insights while providing engineers with the tools and infrastructure to create and deploy AI-powered solutions efficiently.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
 As a Staff Machine Learning Engineer in the AI platform team, you will bridge between Machine Learning/AI research and operations, ensuring that AI-powered solutions are not only accurate during development but also robust and scalable in real-world production scenarios.
   

  

 Together with your team, you will design, implement, deploy, and manage AI-powered solutions delivering on organizational goals and industry standards, evolving and maintaining the Motherbrain AI platform.
   

  

 The Motherbrain AI platform is designed to integrate Large Language Models (LLMs) into business workflows, automating tasks such as summarization, data extraction, and analysis of internal & external data. The platform features a reliable architecture enabling the development of scalable AI workflows with a focus on usability, traceability and support for domain-specific applications.
   

  

 You will be working together with Data Scientists, Fullstack Engineers, Backend Engineers, Data Engineers, UI and UX Designers, and Business Stakeholders to take the Motherbrain platform to the next level and leverage AI as a core part of EQT’s strategy to maximize its competitive advantage.
   

  

**About You**
 You are a technical leader that believes in the power of teamwork. Your technical expertise and ability to solve complex challenges make you a driving force in engineering excellence.
   

  

**Essential Skills & Experience**
* Technical Leadership and teamwork in product-oriented organizations: Experience in teams working with disruptive technologies with high level of interaction and collaboration, evolving and maintaining the technical product roadmap according to the business needs.
* AI/ML Systems Architecture: envision, operationalize, build, and deploy end-to-end ML and AI pipelines at scale.
* Efficient Text Data Processing: Designing and optimizing systems for processing large volumes of textual data efficiently.
* ML Workflows and Pipelines Orchestration: Building and maintaining MLOps pipelines, including CI/CD for machine learning workflows.
* AI Cloud Infrastructure: Working with cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure for ML infrastructure.


**Nice-to-Have Qualifications**
* Hands-on experience with LangChain and LangSmith for building and managing AI workflows.
* Understanding of FastAPI, TypeScript, GraphQL, and other tools used for backend and frontend integration.
* Experience with database technologies and data transformation pipelines (e.g. dbt, BigQuery, ElasticSearch, Redis, PostgreSQL, … ).
* Expertise in developing and deploying scalable, distributed systems for AI solutions.
* Practical experience with Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)
* Strong background in NLP techniques and tools, particularly for summarization, data extraction, and large-scale textual analysis.
* Solid understanding of security and privacy best practices when working with sensitive or proprietary data in machine learning workflows.


**What's in it for me?**
 EQT is a well established company that has worked within its field for a long time. Being one of Europe's largest Private Equity firms you will get a stable employer, being proved by EQTs continued growth during the last years of market turbulence. Due to this, EQT offers attractive compensation packages, with an internal career framework giving you the opportunity to grow within the company. It also includes generous pensions, 6 weeks vacation and a great health care allowance. If you have small children, we also offer a domestic allowance program to enable a good work/life balance. There are of course more benefits on top of this, which we would be happy to tell you about when we meet.
   

  

**Diversity & Inclusion**
 EQT and Motherbrain is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce. We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of ethnicity, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, functional variation, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with functional variations who would like to request a tour of our accommodation, please reach out.
   

  

**About Motherbrain**
 Motherbrain, an integral team within EQT, integrates data science, machine learning, and AI into our investment strategy, offering a unique platform and opportunity to tackle complex, real-world challenges. Our team, sourced from leading tech companies, leverages the latest technology and collaborates closely with EQT's internal business professionals. This collaboration ensures that our innovative solutions significantly impact diverse sectors such as healthcare, technology, and infrastructure. Here, you'll discover an environment that fosters learning and growth, where your contributions influence tangible business outcomes and play a key role in EQT's global strategy.
   

  

**About EQT**
 EQT is a purpose-driven global investment organization focused on active ownership strategies. With a Nordic heritage and a global mindset, EQT has a track record of almost three decades of developing companies across multiple geographies, sectors and strategies. EQT has investment strategies covering all phases of a business’ development, from start-up to maturity. EQT has EUR ‌ 246 billion in total assets under management (EUR ‌ ‌133 billion in fee-generating assets under management), within two business segments – Private Capital and Real Assets.
   

  

 With its roots in the Wallenberg family’s entrepreneurial mindset and philosophy of long-term ownership, EQT is guided by a set of strong values and a distinct corporate culture. EQT manages and advises funds and vehicles that invest across the world with the mission to future-proof companies, generate attractive returns and make a positive impact with everything EQT does.EQT has offices in more than 25 countries across Europe, Asia and the Americas and has more than 1,800 employees.
   

  

 More info: www.eqtgroup.com
   

  

 Follow EQT on LinkedIn, X, YouTube and Instagram

title: Staff Engineer
description:
***This job is with EQT Group, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.***
*Our vision for EQT employees is to build high performing & engaged teams. Our competitive edge comes from fostering an environment where every individual feels valued, empowered, and motivated to drive business impact.
   

  

 Our commitment to inclusion is not just about fairness; We understand and believe that being a great place to work drives the best performance.
   

  

 At EQT, inclusion is a business imperative and it's embedded into our talent strategy, decision-making, and culture to ensure that every individual and team operates at their full potential. By doing so, we unlock better collaboration, stronger innovation, and superior investment outcomes*
**About The Role**
 As a Staff Fullstack Engineer, you will lead technical initiatives, mentor team members, and play a key role in shaping the future of Motherbrain. Working with a modern cloud-based tech stack (GCP), you will drive the design and delivery of scalable systems that enable smarter, data-driven investment decisions.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Design and implement complex, scalable systems for a cloud-based platform.
* Lead and mentor engineering teams, fostering collaboration and technical excellence.
* Collaborate across disciplines with UX/UI designers, ML engineers, and business stakeholders.
* Advocate and implement best practices in testing, CI/CD, and code reviews.
* Engage in strategic planning to align technology initiatives with business goals.


**About You**
 You are a proactive leader with a passion for building innovative systems and empowering teams. Your technical expertise and ability to solve complex challenges make you a driving force in engineering excellence.
   

  

**Essential Skills & Experience**
* Proven track record of leading engineering teams or initiatives.
* Strong knowledge of frontend and backend technologies, including TypeScript, Node.js, React, SQL, and PostgreSQL.
* Expertise in system design and architecture for cloud-based applications (preferably GCP).
* Exceptional communication skills with the ability to influence stakeholders at all levels.
* Growth-oriented mindset with a focus on collaboration and team empowerment.


**Nice-to-Have Qualifications**
* Experience with microservices architecture design and implementation.
* Familiarity with containerization and orchestration tools such as Docker and Kubernetes.
* Knowledge of modern AI tools and APIs (e.g., OpenAI).


**What We Offer**
 At EQT, we value our people and offer a supportive environment for growth and development. As part of the Motherbrain team, you will enjoy:
   

  

* A competitive compensation package, including a generous pension plan and six weeks of vacation.
* Health and wellness benefits, including a domestic allowance program to support work-life balance.
* A vibrant workplace culture with access to a full-time barista and regular team-building activities.
* Opportunities to grow within EQT’s internal career framework.


**Diversity & Inclusion**
 EQT and Motherbrain is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce. We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of ethnicity, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, functional variation, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with functional variations who would like to request a tour of our accommodation, please reach out.
   

  

**About Motherbrain**
 Motherbrain, an integral team within EQT, integrates data science, machine learning, and AI into our investment strategy, offering a unique platform and opportunity to tackle complex, real-world challenges. Our team, sourced from leading tech companies, leverages the latest technology and collaborates closely with EQT's internal business professionals. This collaboration ensures that our innovative solutions significantly impact diverse sectors such as healthcare, technology, and infrastructure. Here, you'll discover an environment that fosters learning and growth, where your contributions influence tangible business outcomes and play a key role in EQT's global strategy.
   

  

**About EQT**
 EQT is a purpose-driven global investment organization focused on active ownership strategies. With a Nordic heritage and a global mindset, EQT has a track record of almost three decades of developing companies across multiple geographies, sectors and strategies. EQT has investment strategies covering all phases of a business’ development, from start-up to maturity. EQT has EUR ‌ 246 billion in total assets under management (EUR ‌ ‌133 billion in fee-generating assets under management), within two business segments – Private Capital and Real Assets.
   

  

 With its roots in the Wallenberg family’s entrepreneurial mindset and philosophy of long-term ownership, EQT is guided by a set of strong values and a distinct corporate culture. EQT manages and advises funds and vehicles that invest across the world with the mission to future-proof companies, generate attractive returns and make a positive impact with everything EQT does.EQT has offices in more than 25 countries across Europe, Asia and the Americas and has more than 1,800 employees.
   

  

 More info: www.eqtgroup.com
   

  

 Follow EQT on LinkedIn, X, YouTube and Instagram

title: Bid Manager till Nationellt Bid Office
description:
HiQ söker en Bid Manager till vårt Bid Office i Stockholm. I rollen som Bid Manager kommer du att, tillsammans med Head of Bid, ansvara för offentliga och privata upphandlingar i Sverige. Det innebär bland annat att samla in svarsunderlag, skicka in anbud och projektleda större anbudssvar. Bid Manager bevakar också nya publicerade ramavtal samt analyserar huruvida de skall besvaras eller inte. I rollen ingår även förvaltning och uppföljning av vunna avtal i form av bland annat statistikredovisning, avropsallokering och att agera kontaktperson för avtal. Bid Manager rapporterar till Head of Bid och samarbetar med HiQs samtliga kontor och lokala säljare.
   

  

 För att trivas hos oss och i rollen tror vi att du som person är en lagspelare som är både driven och tar stort ansvar. Du har förmåga att både samarbeta med andra och arbeta självständigt. Det faller dig naturligt att leverera resultat och du värdesätter kvalitet i det du producerar. Du vill lära dig och utvecklas.
   

  

 Som Bid Manager ingår du i ett team av erfarna säljare och upphandlare som du kan lära dig av. Du kommer också få lära dig om IT genom nära samarbete med experter inom IT-säkerhet, UX, programmering, projektledning, IT-arkitektur och AI. Du kommer också regelbundet få möjlighet att öva din egen projektledningsförmåga när större anbudsvar skall produceras och du projektleder team med experter på området som anbudet gäller.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har:**
* Relevant utbildning eller arbetslivserfarenhet inom sälj, bid management eller offentlig upphandling (LOU/LUFS)
* God förmåga att överblicka och sammanfatta stora informationsmängder.
* God förmåga att dra egna slutsatser och bidra i arbetet med analyser och strategier.
* Ett strukturerat arbetssätt och öga både för helhet och detaljer.
* God språkkänsla och gillar att skriva på svenska.


**Varför HiQ?**
 HiQ är utan tvekan ett av Sveriges mest tekniktunga och spännande konsultbolag med kunder inom en rad olika branscher såsom fintech, retail, fordon, telekom och offentlig sektor. Förutom att vi bidragit till utvecklingen av att snart bli ett kontantlöst samhälle, utvecklar vi även allt från digitaliseringen av elkraftsystem till framtidens autonoma fordon. Enkelt sagt, vi gillar att skapa sådant som förenklar och gör vardagen lite roligare för oss alla. En viktig väg till dessa spännande projekt är ramavtal med aktörer från både offentlig sektor och den privata marknaden. Om du börjar jobba med oss som Bid Manager kommer du vara en central del av HiQs strävan att hjälpa till i de mest intressanta projekten på marknaden.

title: Senior Backend Engineer
description:
**Since 2018, Voi has been on a mission to create safe, sustainable and reliable micromobility for everyone. Today we are the #1 e-scooter service in Europe, operating in 100+ cities with over 275+ MILLION rides to date. It has been an amazing journey and we have no intention of stopping now!**
**To be able to reach our mission - we need great problem solvers onboard (yes, talking to all Backend Engineers out there).**
**At Voi, you won’t just be working with the latest technology - you’ll shape the product we put out on the streets. You’ll have the opportunity to work with a wide range of engineering; from designing the vehicle, soldering the IoT hardware, creating the communication protocol, developing the tech foundation, innovating on the app and finally operating all this as a whole.**
**YOUR MISSION AT VOI**
**Role**
 As a Senior Backend Engineer you’re a part of a cross functional team with highly skilled Mobile Engineers, UX Designers and Product professionals. You’ll play a key role in Voi’s continued growth and success. Your responsibility is to build features that engage and empower our users and drive the app experience forward. This will include:
   

  

* Build and design scalable and reliable backend for our various products
* Work closely with peer teams (data, mobile, IoT, design, ML, product), and business partners (marketing, repairing services, logistics)
* Large scale data processing to understand user behavior and help define new product features
* Be creative and drive new ideas regarding architecture, tools, products and languages


**What You Need To Embark**
 We use Golang, but there is no requirement for previous experience in that language. We believe that good engineers can switch and learn new languages and technologies. To have the best start with us at Voi, we believe you have:
   

  

* 3+ years of experience as a Senior Engineer building and designing scalable and reliable backend
* Good communication skills and see collaboration as a key to success
* Experience writing well-structured, testable, reliable, efficient and easily maintainable code
* Ability to communicate technical ideas clearly and effectively
* Used to work with cloud infrastructure (GCP, AWS or Azure)
* Experience in building systems with microservices architecture
* Experience of working in diverse and cross functional teams towards a common goal


**WHY VOI?**
 Working At Voi Is More Than Just a Job; Our People Promise Includes a Personal Voiage Where You Will Grow As a Professional And Be a Part Of a Team And Culture That Builds Something Meaningful For Society. In Addition To This You’ll Have The Opportunity To
   

  

* Join Europes #1 micromobility company
* Get “skin in the game” through our employee options program and be a part of building a world class organisation
* Work with inspiring, motivated and fun colleagues towards a common goal
* Join the micromobility-revolution and be a part of creating sustainable cities made for living, free from noise and pollution


 Since 2018,
 **Voi** 
 has been on a mission to create safe, sustainable and reliable micromobility for everyone. Today we are the leading shared micromobility operator in Europe, with HQ in Stockholm (Sweden), operating 100,000+ vehicles in 100+ towns and cities across 12 countries, serving 7+ million riders with over 300+ MILLION rides to date, and we have no intention of stopping here! We believe that micromobility will play a central role in changing how people move in our towns and cities in the future and want to ensure that the micromobility transformation happens the right way - through real innovative technology, partnership and transparent dialogue with towns, cities and governments, and by adapting our products to the local needs. In addition to improving quality of life in cities around the world, we are contributing to the solution for climate change by making sustainable transportation options more widely available and promoting renewable energy use and circularity along our supply chain.
   

  

**Diversity Matters**
 As a Voiager, we offer you a friendly and fast-paced workplace where you can bring your whole self to work, regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, religion, disability or sexual orientation - and welcome applications from whoever you are, including veterans, those actively serving as a Reservist and their partners. What is most important to us is how you treat others and what skills and value you bring to our team. We believe that having a wide diversity of people with different backgrounds and perspectives within Voi is essential to our success in delivering the best user experience to our equally diverse user base. With employees from over 50 nationalities working within Voi, we believe we have made good progress but know we can still do more - therefore we discourage any photos, personal letters, or disclosure of any information that concerns other information than your professional experience.

title: Mobile Android Developer
description:
Do you have a passion for mobile application development and IoT? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you. The Digital and Access Solutions (DAS) business segment within the EMEIA Division is looking for a Mobile Android Developer to join the Wireless Lock product unit, based in Stockholm, Sweden. You'll be part of a collaborative culture that empowers you to build a career you can be proud of.
   

  

**What You Would Do As Our Mobile Android Developer**
 You would develop applications for configuration and operations of our wireless locks and systems. You would join a cross functional agile software team with mobile and cloud developers, QAs and a UX designer. You would work closely with our firmware team regarding communication with the devices. On top of this you would cooperate with product management on the app requirements.
   

  

 You would also:
   

  

* Contribute to planning activities by analyzing requirements, make specifications and break down implementation work (epics and stories).
* Investigate and resolve customer-reported issues.
* Take part in end user testing activities.
* Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies.


**The Skills And Experience You Need**
 We are looking for someone who has:
   

  

* A minimum of 3 years of experience in Android app development in Kotlin.
* Experience with RESTful APIs and integration with cloud services.
* Experience with git, continuous integration and delivery practices.
* Strong command of written and spoken English.
* Technical education in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or similar. Bachelor's degree or higher preferred.


 Ideally, you have experience working with several of the following - development of mobile applications for connected IoT devices, BLE communication, Jetpack Compose, APIs for offline storage, threading and performance tuning, security technologies such as TLS, Keychain, MFA, OAuth and PKI, iOS development, cross platform languages such as React native (expo), Kotlin multi-platform or Flutter, SAFe agile methodology. In addition, you are a result-oriented problem solver by heart that sees solutions instead of problems. You share our belief in lean and agile values, cross-functional teams, where many competences are working together for successful projects.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We’re passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress a lifelong career with us – here’s what we have to offer:
   

  

* Learning and career development opportunities, whether it’s online learning, management training or enhancing your skills.
* A competitive salary and incentive schemes.
* The opportunity to grow your skills in a versatile way and develop your career in a respected global group.
* Agile and innovative working environment.
* Motivated and encouraging team around you.
* Stable employment in a friendly international atmosphere.
* Hybrid working model with minimum of 2 office days per week


**We review applications regularly, so don't wait**
 We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us. Just set up your profile and apply here.
   

  

 To make sure your personal data is safe, we don’t look at any applications sent by email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the process, email Mona Yusefi, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at mona.yusefi@assaabloy.com .
   

  

 Depending on the risk profile for the role, a background screening will need to be performed. Final candidates may therefore be a subject to a background screening. The performance of a background check is subject to consent and based on our Applicant Privacy Notice
   

  

 Let’s create a safer and more open world - together!
   

  

 To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 61,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Cybersecurity Solution Architect
description:
Job Description


As CS Solution Architect, you will focus on technical aspects of security solutions like**PKI, IDS, Secure boot**and work with conceptual CS solutions and architectural topology, writing Cybersecurity attribute requirements and provide guidelines for allocation of requirements on ECU level. You will also execute the vehicle TARA by considering the E/E architect and project topology, drive the project from a Cybersecurity point of view, define the CS project time plan, coordinate, and drive the project with affected stakeholders and ensure deliveries according to the overall time plan in the project.In this work, you will get the opportunity to work with the latest Cybersecurity solutions according to state of the art and collaborate with experts within this domain. This position would be in “Cybersecurity Infrastructure Capabilities” within the department (Cybersecurity and Functional Safety) at our client. Proficient at leading all phases of projects, programs and initiatives of diverse scope and complexity. Works and collaborates with different ART (agile release Train) in either a lead or support role based on business need and introduce Cybersecurity infrastructure requirements.As a person, you have a broad technical know-how combined with very good people skills and a strong belief in agile methods. You have a strong ability to inspire, develop and motivate individuals and teams.


Requirements

* Previous experience working with type approval for R155
* Previous experience of working as a CS engineer or CS architect with a focus on embedded engineering.
* Knowledge of cybersecurity requirement system engineering
* Knowledge of TARA execution.
* Knowledge of connected communication technologies (CAN, Ethernet)
* Documented experience writing cybersecurity requirements based on common practices.
* Good knowledge of PKI (both Onboard (Vehicle/ ECU level) and Offboard (Cloud)
* Experience in developing and/or designing CS solutions, specially SecOC on J1939 and LIN, is a plus.
* Familiar with Vector solutions within cybersecurity.

title: IT-tekniker - Trainee Familjen Helsingborg
description:
**IT-tekniker - Trainee Familjen Helsingborg**
==============================================


Helsingborg


Vill du vara med och göra skillnad? Kickstarta din karriär som trainee hos oss!


**Om arbetsplatsen**
--------------------



Vi i Familjen Helsingborg spår en spännande framtid och sätter utveckling i fokus. Hos oss arbetar du med kvalificerade uppdrag samtidigt som du får personlig utveckling och ett brett nätverk. Som trainee i Familjen Helsingborg kommer du att få värdefulla utbildningsdagar inom bland annat projektledning, presentationsteknik och samtalsteknik. Tillsammans med dina traineekollegor kommer du dessutom att få träffa ledning, politiker och specialister på studiebesök i Familjen Helsingborgs kommuner och därmed fördjupa dina kunskaper i offentlig sektor.



Denna tjänst rekryteras genom Familjen Helsingborg och du blir anställd i en av samarbetets kommuner. Familjen Helsingborg består av elva kommuner i nordvästra Skåne och vi skapar mervärden genom att arbeta tillsammans. Vi vill att Familjen Helsingborg ska upplevas som en sammanhängande stadsbygd och uppfattas som innovativ och spännande. Vi är: Bjuv, Båstad, Helsingborg, Höganäs, Klippan, Landskrona, Perstorp, Svalöv, Åstorp, Ängelholm och Örkelljunga. Inom vårt samarbete ingår även kommunala bolag.


**Arbetsbeskrivning**
---------------------



Kickstarta din IT-karriär hos oss! Är du intresserad av IT och vill utvecklas inom teknik, support och digitalisering? Då är denna tjänst perfekt för dig!



Vi förstärker vårt team med en IT-trainee som vill få bred erfarenhet av IT-drift och systemförvaltning. Som IT-tekniker hos oss kommer du att arbeta med felsökning, installation och underhåll av IT-utrustning, samt ge support till användare både på plats och på distans. Du kommer även att delta i projekt, hjälpa verksamheten att identifiera IT-lösningar och skapa rutiner och lathundar för att effektivisera arbetet.



Detta är en fantastisk möjlighet för dig som nyligen avslutat en akademisk IT-utbildning och vill utvecklas i en dynamisk miljö!



Till Traineeprogrammet söker vi kandidater som anses ha särskilt goda förutsättningar för att i framtiden inta ledande eller strategiska specialistfunktioner. Traineeprogrammet ger mycket god inblick i hur kommunal verksamhet fungerar och du får ett fantastiskt nätverk inför det framtida yrkeslivet.



Som trainee arbetar du med kvalificerade uppdrag i din hemkommun och får personlig utveckling genom traineeprogrammets utvecklingsdagar. Du arbetar och driver även ett projekt tillsammans med dina traineekollegor. Under anställningsåret läggs cirka 25% av arbetstiden på utvecklingsdagar genom programmet. Traineeprogrammet pågår under 12 månader med start den 1 september 2025. Vilken kommun din anställning är förlagd i förmedlas inför slutintervjuerna.



I vårt traineeprogram erbjuder vi:  

* Stimulerande arbetsuppgifter
* Personlig utveckling
* Ett ovärderligt yrkesnätverk
* Kunskap om kommunal verksamhet
* Teamträning
* Utbildningar inom projektledning m.m
* Breddning i en annan kommun
* Handledare

**Kvalifikationer**
-------------------



Du som söker är en nyutexaminerad akademiker, max två år gammal högskole- och/eller universitetsexamen. Du har en liten arbetslivserfarenhet men ett stort engagemang för samhällsfrågor. Vi ser gärna att du som söker har akademisk utbildning inom datateknik, datavetenskap, informatik, informationstekniker, systemvetare med teknisk inriktning eller annan likvärdig utbildning.



Du är en samhällsutvecklare som gärna ifrågasätter och kommer med nya idéer. Du har förmåga att driva utvecklings- och förändringsarbeten. För att lyckas i ditt uppdrag behöver du också ha en god samarbetsförmåga, vara kommunikativ i bemötande, tal och skrift samt ha förmåga att arbeta såväl självständigt som i grupp.



Vi kommer att lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper. För att bli antagen till traineeprogrammet ska du ha erhållit din högskole-/universitetsexamen innan traineeprogrammets start den 1 september 2025.

  


**Övrig information**
---------------------



Sista ansökningsdag: 15 mars 2025



Anställningsform: Visstidsanställning



Omfattning: Heltid



Tillträdesdatum: 1 september 2025



Varaktighet: 12 månader



Lön: 30 500kr



Antal tjänster: 1


**Övrig information**
---------------------



Skicka in din ansökan via ansökningslänken. Går du vidare efter första urvalet kommer du att kallas till en av våra rekryteringsdagar den 2 eller 3 april. Går du vidare efter rekryteringsdagarna kommer du att kallas till intervju den 23 eller 24 april. Efter intervjuerna kommer vi att göra ytterligare ett urval. Blir du antagen till vårt traineeprogram får du besked om detta senast under vecka 19.

  

  

Läs mer: traineeprogrammet.se
  

  

För att kvalitetssäkra rekryteringsprocessen i Helsingborgs stad använder vi rekryteringsverktyget ReachMee. Därför ber vi dig att skicka in din ansökan via ReachMee genom att klicka på ansökningslänken i annonsen. Du som söker jobb och har skyddade personuppgifter ska kontakta rekryterande chef i annonsen som kommer guida dig vidare för en säker ansökningsprocess. Du ska inte ansöka digitalt via ansökningslänken.
  

  

Då vi inför denna rekrytering redan tagit ställning till de rekryteringskanaler vi önskar använda undanber vi oss vänligen men bestämt att bli kontaktade för ytterligare erbjudanden om kompetensförmedling, annonserings- och rekryteringshjälp.  




**Kontaktpersoner**
-------------------


Amanda Törnqvist


Projektledare


042-103526


amanda.tornqvist@familjenhelsingborg.se


Ansök

title: Network Engineer
description:
**Description**


As a Network Engineer for Hitachi Energy, HVDC business you will be designing and conducting experiments, analyzing, and interpreting the data, preparing complete project documents in area of responsibility. Providing cost effective quality solutions and delivering within budget and contract. Ensuring adherence to safety standards and mitigation of potential risks to increase production. Openness and curiosity and high level of independent work is typical characteristics for the profile to fit the team.  

  

We are interested to learn more about you and what you can contribute with so don’t hesitate to apply even though you don’t fulfil all requirements.  

  

**Your responsibilities**

* You will be responsible for development of new network solutions to the base solution to increase throughput in FST (Factory System Test).
* Supports the projects with know-how of the base solution and other key stake holders such as R & D department.
* You will be having strong documentation skills.
* You will mentor, guides, and onboard new junior project engineers to get them up to speed with the base solution.
* Living Hitachi Energy's core values of safety and integrity means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business.

**Your background**

* You have experience of enterprise production networks.
* Knowledge of production near systems and automations.
* Outgoing team player capable of independent work to get the job done.
* Able to liaise with other stakeholders and to see the bigger picture.
* Good knowledge of Cisco, Fortinet, and Palo Alto equipment.

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks
* More benefits could be connected to this specific role

**Additional information**


Are you ready for an exciting new challenge? Does the above description sound like you? Welcome to apply for this position!


Recruiting Manager Micael Nystrom, micael.nystrom@hitachienergy.com, will answer your questions about the position. Union representatives – Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Hjort, +46 107-38 29 86; Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 107-38 70 43; Unionen: Fredrik Holmgren, +46 107-38 21 85. All other questions can be directed to Talent Partner Ingrid Schjelderup, ingrid.schjelderup@hitachienergy.com.

**Qualified individuals with a disability may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Hitachi Energy career site as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by completing a** **general inquiry form** **on our website. Please include your contact information and specific details about your required accommodation to support you during the job application process.**
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**This is solely for job seekers with disabilities requiring accessibility assistance or an accommodation in the job application process. Messages left for other purposes will not receive a response.**
