Vi genomför regelbundet spännande aktiviteter där du som konsult får möjlighet att träffa och umgås med dina kollegor under roliga och avslappnande former.
   

  

*Mer om oss*
 Centric är ett IT-företag med 380 anställda, med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö och Linköping. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras tecknade kollektivavtal med Unionen.

title: CTO till Cirkus Venues
description:
*Vill du driva och leda teknologisk innovation i en dynamisk och kreativ miljö? Som CTO hos Cirkus Venues får du möjligheten att kombinera tekniskt ledarskap med strategiskt tänkande för att forma framtidens upplevelser inom hotell- och arenaverksamhet.*
**Din vardag**
 Som CTO hos Cirkus Venues kommer du att spela en avgörande roll i att säkerställa att teknologin stödjer våra affärsmål och förbättrar gäst- och besökarupplevelsen. Din vardag kommer att vara varierad och dynamisk, och du kommer att:
   

  

* Utveckla och implementera tekniska strategier som stödjer både hotell- och arenaverksamhetens affärsmål.
* Leda och motivera IT-teknikteamet för att säkerställa hög prestanda och kundnöjdhet i allt från den dagliga verksamheten till affärsdrivna förändringsprojekt.
* Bevaka, utvärdera och integrera relevanta nya teknologier och system för att förbättra gäst- och besökarupplevelsen.
* Samarbeta med andra avdelningar för att identifiera och lösa tekniska utmaningar.
* Säkerställa att alla tekniska lösningar är säkra och följer gällande regler och standarder.
* På ledningens uppdrag säkerställa optimal cyber- och infosäkerhet.


 Genom att ta en aktiv roll i allt från strategisk planering till operativt genomförande bidrar du till att Cirkus Venues fortsätter vara en innovativ och ledande aktör i branschen.
   

  

 Rollen innefattar personal- och budgetansvar. Du rapporterar till CFO och utgår från vårt kontor på Djurgården i Stockholm.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du:
   

  

* Har bakgrund inom IT och teknik i en roll som gett dig goda ledarerfarenheter.
* Relevant utbildning inom området eller motsvarande erfarenhet.
* Har erfarenhet av systematiskt datasäkerhetsarbete, inklusive Information Security Management System (ISMS), GDPR och ISO 27001.
* Har god kunskap om Microsofts lösningar inom 365 och säkerhet (SOC).
* Har stark förmåga att leda team och kommunicera effektivt på alla nivåer.
* Är strategiskt tänkande och har erfarenhet av att lösa komplexa problem.
* Erfarenhet av att hantera personal, budget och resurser på ett effektivt sätt.
* Kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.


 Som person är du engagerad, analytisk och strukturerad med en naturlig förmåga att skapa förtroende och engagemang hos dina medarbetare. Du har ett framåtblickande perspektiv och kan prioritera både operativa och strategiska mål i en föränderlig miljö.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Hos Cirkus Venues lever vi för att skapa enastående och minnesvärda upplevelser och vi kan med stolthet säga att vi är riktigt bra på det.
   

  

 Cirkus Venues består av Cirkus Arena & Restaurang, Hotell Hasselbacken, Backstage Hotel och Konsthallen Café och Restaurang samt Pop Story och The Visitor, alla belägna på Kungliga Djurgården i Stockholm. År 2027 öppnas även Stockholms nya Kulturscen Gasometer i norra Djurgårdsstaden.
   

  

**Kontakt**
 I den här rekryteringen samarbetar Cirkus Venues med Wise IT. Vill du veta mer om jobbet, kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult, Anja Widell på anja.widell@wiseit.se.
   

  

 Wise IT kan tyvärr inte ta emot ansökningar via mail, då vi värnar om din personliga integritet. Du kan läsa mer om hur vi behandlar personuppgifter enligt GDPR i Wise Group-koncernens policy för behandling av personuppgifter.
   

  

 Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess genomför vi bakgrundskontroller på vår slutkandidat. Innan en bakgrundskontroll genomförs kommer du ombedjas ge ditt samtycke.
   

  

 Urval sker löpande, välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
description:
**About us** 




 Avy is transforming the housing experience by enabling property companies to provide a modern, seamless service for their residents. Our platform helps reduce operational costs, create new revenue streams, and enhance tenant satisfaction - all through an intuitive digital experience.
 



 For over six years, Avy has been shaping the digital housing experience together with its customers, partners, and employees. As the leading Tenant Experience platform in the Nordics, we reach more than 400,000 households - approximately 20% of all tenants in Sweden. Our mission is to push boundaries and redefine what it means to live in a rental home - making it more sustainable, seamless, and secure.
 



  





**Role Description** 




 As a
 **Senior Machine Learning Engineer** 
 at Avy, you will be at the forefront of integrating artificial intelligence into our platform, driving innovation and optimizing our business operations. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and deploy AI-driven solutions that enhance automation, decision-making, and user experience. With expertise in generative AI and Machine Learning, you will explore cutting-edge AI technologies, create prototypes, and implement applied AI/ML solutions on top of the rest of our platform and it's features.
 



  





 Your
 **impact** 
 on our platform and our end-users (~20% of rental tenants in Sweden) is going to be
 **instant** 
 !
 



  





 Areas where we are investing most of our applied AI efforts today are our vertically focused AI Copilot which is fine-tuned for property industry and is helping both property owners and tenants in their every-day lives.
 



 Another area is Insights where we are applying advanced ML techniques in order to go beyond classical BI and enable our users to leverage AI and ML on top of the data they create and consume in our platform.
 



  





**This role requires creating Applied AI/ML solution
 
 in Golang.**




  





**Qualifications:** 



* Bachelor’s, Master’s or PhD degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field.
* Experience in utilizing AI technologies in every-day work
* Fluency in using AI code assistant
* Experience writing production-ready Golang code
* Proven experience with generative AI and deploying AI models into production.
* Experience working with various NLP, LLM and related machine learning concepts
* Programming skills in Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar AI frameworks.
* Experience with cloud-based AI solutions
* Knowledge of big data processing, optimization techniques, and model scalability.
* Ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams, including engineers, designers, product managers or business developers.
* Strong problem-solving skills and a passion for staying up to date with the latest AI advancements.
* Experience with responsible AI practices, including model interpretability, bias mitigation, and data privacy.
* Familiarity with both open-source and proprietary AI solutions is a plus.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to present AI concepts to stakeholders effectively.



  





**What we offer:** 



* Opportunity to shape the technical direction of a fast-growing prop-tech scale-up
* Collaborative and innovative work environment
* Competitive salary and benefits package
* Professional development opportunities
* Chance to work on cutting-edge technologies and solve complex problems



  





**Location (on-site):** 




 Stockholm, Sweden
 



  





*For this position, Avy is working with internal recruitment resources and is not accepting external agencies. Those kind of requests will not be answered.*

title: Consulting Manager within eHealth
description:
Cambio is one of the Nordics' leading suppliers in e-health with a comprehensive offering for the entire health and care chain. Our e-health solutions support healthcare professionals in their daily work and offer patients safer and more easily accessible care. We are proud to be an important part of Swedish health and social care. We are growing continuously and now have about 1000 employees in several countries.
   

  

**The position**
 As a Consulting Manager you will have the opportunity to work within the growing e-health-business supporting our customers on their digitalization journey. You will share your time between leadership/people management of your team and developing our consulting organization and consulting services.
   

  

 In your role you will work closely with a team of consulting managers to ensure the best possible delivery to our customers. You will together be responsible for capacity planning and competence development for the consulting team and for ensuring we have the right skills set and conditions to deliver value to our customers.
   

  

 You will report to the Consulting Director for Healthcare Consulting which is part of our Delivery organization at Cambio.
   

  

 At Cambio, we encourage taking initiatives that contribute to the development of the company and ourselves. For us, it is important that you should have the opportunity to grow, both as a person and as an employee. Our culture is described through the words “Trust”, “Care” and “Together” which permeate everything we do.
   

  

**About You**
 To succeed in this role, we believe that you, in addition to being an engaged and engaging leader, are result oriented, well-structured, driven and have a strong customer focus. You naturally have good people skills and the ability to build and maintain strong relationships, both internally and externally as well as being a pragmatic team player who enjoys working together with your colleagues.
   

  

**Requirements** 
  

  

* Experience as a leader and/or project manager, eg within consulting
* Experience from Consulting and/or project management
* University degree within eg. Business or IT
* Very good communication and presentation skills - verbally and in writing in Swedish and English
* Ability to travel for work when required


**It's a bonus if you**
* Experience from the Public Sector and/or e-health
* Experience from Sales and business development, preferably within IT/Digitalization
* Experience from forecasting and managing a budget


**Place of employment** 
 : Stockholm
   

  

 At Cambio we value a healthy work-life balance, and to encourage that we apply a hybrid working-model. Together with your team you decide which days you work at the office. On the remaining days you can work remotely from home, but you are always more than welcome to work at the office too.
   

  

**Scope** 
 : Full time
   

  

**Form of employment:** 
 Permanent employment, 6 months trial period
   

  

**Other:** 
 We screen the applications and hold interviews continuously so please send your application as soon as possible via the link.
   

  

 We encourage and eagerly welcome all applications, but we will only consider candidates who are located and have the legal right to work in Sweden
 **.** 
 We will ask for verification during the process.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**
 Read more about us
 **here!**
 Are you interested in Cambio but you don’t feel that this position is the perfect match? Check out our other open positions at the career site
 **here!**
 Cambio Healthcare Systems is Sweden’s leading suppliers of healthcare information systems and a growing player in the European market with just over 100,000 users across general and university hospitals, specialist units and outpatient units. Through the use of our integrated solutions, our customers provide services to 4 million patients.

title: French speaking Gender-Based Violence in Emergencies Officer to Mali
description:
**Introduction**
 The Swedish Civil Contingencies Agency (MSB) recruits committed and skilled experts for our humanitarian, resilience and peace support operations worldwide on a daily basis. We have great experience on working together and strengthening other organisations for example the UN and the EU in crisis, conflicts or other disasters.
   

  

 MSB is currently looking to recruit a French speaking Gender-Based Violence in Emergencies (GBViE) Officer for a deployment with UNICEF to Bamako, Mali. Durations for the mission is initially 6 months with possibility for extension, with start as soon as possible.
   

  

 Mali is facing a severe humanitarian crisis driven by ongoing conflict and climate shocks. In 2024, extreme heat and floods worsened conditions, leaving over a third of the population in need of assistance. Nearly 378,000 people have been displaced, many of them women and children in regions like Gao and Mopti. The security situation has deteriorated, with over 22,000 human rights violations reported, including sexual violence and attacks on children. Education has been disrupted, leaving children increasingly vulnerable. A national disaster was declared in August, and the school year was postponed. In September, an attack in Bamako highlighted the growing insecurity. Between July and September, cases of gender-based violence rose by 72%, with women and girls making up the majority of survivors. Addressing the scale and complexity of GBV in Mali requires a concerted effort to enhance prevention, response, and risk mitigation measures. This includes scaling up service delivery, strengthening inter-agency coordination, and empowering women- and girls-led organizations to take a central role in humanitarian programming. In response to the crisis, UNICEF is actively working in Mali to protect children and promote their rights. As part of its global mission to save lives and help children fulfill their potential, UNICEF focuses on providing critical services such as education, healthcare, and protection. Through partnerships and coordinated efforts, UNICEF continues to provide vital aid and support to children and families affected by the ongoing conflict and humanitarian crisis.
   

  

 Employed by the MSB on an international mission you will receive a monthly salary 61 910 SEK as well as a comprehensive allowances and benefits package, ranging from free home leave travel to access to psychosocial support.
   

  

**Introduction swedish**
 MSB arbetar dagligen med att kompetensförsörja insatser runt om i världen. Vi har stor erfarenhet av att samarbeta och stärka andra organisationer som exempelvis FN och EU i katastrof- och konfliktsituationer.
   

  

 MSB söker nu en fransktalande Gender-Based Violence in Emergencies (GBViE) Officer till en insats med UNICEF i Bamako, Mali. Insatsen är på 6 månader med en möjlighet till en förlängning på ytterligare 6 månader, med startdatum så snart som möjligt.
   

  

 Mali står inför en allvarlig humanitär kris orsakad av pågående konflikt och klimatpåverkan. År 2024 förvärrades situationen av extrem värme och översvämningar, vilket har lämnat mer än en tredjedel av befolkningen i behov av hjälp. Nästan 378 000 personer har blivit fördrivna, varav många är kvinnor och barn i regioner som Gao och Mopti. Säkerhetssituationen har försämrats, med över 22 000 dokumenterade människorättsbrott, inklusive sexuellt våld och angrepp på barn. Utbildningen har också blivit störd, vilket gör att barnen blir allt mer utsatta och när en nationell katastrof förklarades i augusti sköts skolåret upp. I september inträffade en attack i Bamako som belyste den växande osäkerheten. Mellan juli och september ökade fallen av könsrelaterat våld med 72 %, där kvinnor och flickor utgör majoriteten av de drabbade. Som svar på krisen arbetar UNICEF aktivt i Mali för att skydda barn och främja deras rättigheter. Som en del av sin globala mission att rädda liv och hjälpa barn att nå sin fulla potential fokuserar UNICEF på att tillhandahålla viktiga tjänster som utbildning, hälso- och sjukvård samt skydd. Genom partnerskap och samordnade insatser fortsätter UNICEF att ge avgörande hjälp och stöd till barn och familjer som drabbats av den pågående konflikten och den humanitära krisen.
   

  

 Vi värderar vår insatspersonals välbefinnande högt och du kommer att ha tillgång till stödfunktioner inom hälsa och säkerhet från MSB dygnet runt när du är på insats.
   

  

**Duties**
 Under the supervision of the Gender based violence in Emergencies (GBViE) Specialist, the GBViE Officer prepares, executes, manages, and implements a variety of technical and administrative programme tasks to facilitate programme development, implementation, programme progress monitoring, evaluating and reporting, with a particular focus on Gender based violence in emergency situations in the North and central regions of Mali. This includes a collaboration with UNICEF WASH specialists, to address the heightened vulnerabilities of women and girls in accessing safe and dignified WASH services, especially in displaced and crisis-affected communities.
   

  

 Expected duties:
   

  

 Programme Development and Planning
   

  

* Conduct child protection and GBV situation analysis.
* Collaborate with WASH sector on GBV risk mitigation and contribute to setting programme goals and strategies.


 Programme Management and Monitoring
   

  

* Address implementation issues with partners and monitor resource use.
* Develop tools to assess GBV risk mitigation and ensure ethical data collection.


 Technical and Operational Support
   

  

* Conduct field visits to assess progress and provide support.
* Engage women and girls in WASH programme design.


 Networking and Partnerships
   

  

* Build partnerships with government and women-led organizations.
* Research donors and prepare fundraising materials.
* Participate in coordination and advocacy events.


 Innovation and Capacity Building
   

  

* Share lessons learned to build stakeholder capacity and promote innovative approaches for sustainable results.
* Contribute to capacity-building initiatives on child protection and GBV.


**Qualifications**
**Experience**
* A minimum of two years of relevant professional work experience in social development planning and management in child protection/GBV related areas is required.
* Experience working in a developing country is required.
* Background/familiarity with emergency is required.
* Relevant experience in programme development in child protection related areas in a UN agency or affiliated organization is considered as an asset.
* It is desirable to have experience of implementing gender/GBV sensitive WASH and alternative energy solutions for refugees and host communities, particularly in remote and hard-to-reach areas.


 Be sure to describe your experience of the above tasks in your application.
   

  

**Education**
 A university degree in one of the following fields is required: international development, human rights, psychology, sociology, international law, or another relevant social science field.
   

  

 A relevant combination of academic qualifications and experience may be accepted in lieu of a formal university degree.
   

  

**Languages**
 Fluency in English and French is essential, both spoken and written.
   

  

 Knowledge of local language or any other official UN languages is an asset.
   

  

**Other Requirements**
 We are looking for persons with a strong commitment towards humanitarian relief and disaster operations. It is of utmost priority that you understand, respect and act in the spirit of the mandate and core values of the MSB.
   

  

 Prior to employment a medical examination must be carried out and the results must be approved by the MSB. Certain diseases and conditions can preclude international deployment. If you have any questions regarding the MSB:s health requirements, please contact our medical coordinators, medical.coordinator@msb.se
   

  

 You must inform your regular employer of your potential assignment with the MSB.
   

  

 MSB operations are based on the needs of populations affected by crisis, and human equality. Through my behavior and work as MSB field staff, I actively strive to prevent discrimination and harassment based on sex, ethnic origin, age, religion or belief, political opinion, disability, sexual orientation and gender identity or expression.
   

  

**Profile**
* You must be able to interact with sensitivity and display respect for diversity and gender in multi-cultural environments.
* A capacity for working under pressure is essential, as work is often performed under difficult and demanding conditions, where the focus frequently shifts due to changes in priority.
* You must possess a high level of professional and personal maturity together with an ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with colleagues, managers and external partners, such as UN organizations, NGOs, recipient governments and host populations.
* You are expected to have excellent analytical and communicative skills, show initiative and take both a hands-on and an analytical approach to tasks and problems.


**Contractual conditions**
 Working with the MSB on international operations means that you are temporarily employed by the MSB. The MSB pays a monthly salary of 61 910 SEK during the mission and you may also receive a salary supplement on 1000 SEK if you have experience exceeding the minimum requirements.
   

  

 The MSB will also pay an additional expenses allowances during the time you are working in the mission country. MSB pays for accommodation of appropriate standard and return travel, plus one home leave travel during the contract period. You will also receive a benefits package, ranging from access to psychosocial support, counselling from medical coordinators and insurances during the mission.
   

  

 Due to potential covid-19 regulations from partnerorganisations and host countries, we sometimes cannot offer this position to unvaccinated or people over the age of 60.
   

  

 The mission is intended too start as soon as possible so in your application we want you to write from what date you are available.
   

  

 The MSB applies a policy of equal opportunities to avoid any form of discrimination. We strive for gender balance and qualified women are strongly encouraged to apply.
   

  

 How to apply:
   

  

 If you wish to apply to this position you first need to create an account on MyPages. Please note; the information that you provide on MyPages will form the basis for your CV. When you have created you account and registered your CV-details on MyPages you submit your application by clicking on the "Apply" button in the add, and the follow the specified steps. If you already have an account on Mypages you can go directly to Apply-botton. If you find any trouble with MyPages, please contact our mypagess support; mypages@msb.se
   

  

 It is your responsibility as an applicant to document your skills in a way that allows an objective and qualitative assessment. As a government agency we are subject to the principle of public access to official records. This means that if someone requests copies of application documents, we are obliged to disclose them. If your identity is protected, you should contact the HR officer stated below, before registering any information on MyPages.
   

  

 Please note that your application need to be in English.
   

  

 The MSB will process the applications on an ongoing basis during the application period, which means that we wish you to submit your application as soon as possible.
   

  

 Welcome with your application!
   

  

**Application deadline**
 2025-02-20
   

  

**Point of contact**
 Hannah Johansson
   

  

 hannah.johansson@msb.se
   

  

 +46102405293

title: Future Talent Programme - for a healthier tomorrow
description:
Vill du vara en del av ett företag där ditt arbete gör verklig skillnad? Vi söker drivna talanger som vill bli en del av vårt Future Talent Programme – en unik möjlighet för dig som vill kickstarta din karriär och axla rollen som verksamhetskonsult inom E-hälsa.
   

  

 Som trainee hos oss får du under sex intensiva månader de verktyg, den kunskap och den erfarenhet du behöver för att lyckas i rollen som verksamhetskonsult. Som verksamhetskonsult arbetar du nära våra kunder och deltar i aktiviteter såsom verksamhetsanalys, utbildning, testning, processutveckling och kundanpassning av våra lösningar. Under din tid hos oss tillåts du bli en del av vår engagerade kultur och får möjlighet att bidra till ett samhällsviktigt uppdrag.
   

  

 Låter det intressant? Då är vårt
 **Future Talent Programme** 
 precis vad du letar efter! 🚀
   

  

**Om** 
**programmet**
 Med Start i September Får Du Under Programmets Sex Månader Lära Dig De Färdigheter Som Krävs För Att Jobba Som Verksamhetskonsult På Cambio. Programmet Är Utformat För Att Du Ska Utvecklas På Bästa Sätt Och Erbjuder En Kombination Av Teori Och Praktik Samt Ett Kontinuerligt Mentorskap. Vi Har Designat Ett Unikt Program Där Du Genom Olika Moment Rustas Med De Kunskaper Och Kompetenser Som Behövs För Att Bli Framgångsrik i Rollen. Här Får Du En Överblick Över Hur Din Resa Kommer Att Se Ut
   

  

  

  

*Läs mer om programmet här*
**Varför Cambio** 
**🚀**
 Det här är inte bara ett traineeprogram – det är din chans att bli en del av Nordens ledande leverantör inom e-hälsa. Genom ditt arbete kommer du tillsammans med oss påverka och forma morgondagens hälso- sjukvård och bidra till ett samhällsviktigt uppdrag.
   

  

 Cambio är en av Nordens ledande leverantörer inom e-hälsa med ett heltäckande erbjudande inom hälso- och sjukvård. Vi erbjuder innovativa digitala lösningarna som skapar värde för vårdgivaren och en bättre och säkrare upplevelse för patienten. Vi är en viktig pusselbit i svensk sjukvård och är stolta över det. Idag är vi runt 1100 anställda i flera länder.
   

  

 På Cambio uppmuntrar vi egna initiativ som bidrar till företagets och vår egen utveckling. För oss är det viktigt att du får möjlighet att växa, både personligt och karriärmässigt. Vår kultur genomsyras av tre ord: ’’Trust’’, ’’Care’’ och ’’Together’’, som präglar allt vi gör här på Cambio.
   

  

**Vi Söker Dig Som**
* Är nyutexaminerad eller tar din examen senast sommaren 2025 om minst 180 hp.
* Din högskoleutbildning, som är högst två år gammal, är inom hälso- och medicinsk teknik, data- och systemvetenskap, IT och management eller motsvarande.
* Har mycket goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska, såväl i tal som i skrift.
* Är öppen för och har möjlighet att resa i tjänst vid behov
* Intresse för IT, Teknik och e-hälsa


 Som person har du en stark
 **analytisk** 
 förmåga och trivs med att lösa problem på ett strukturerat sätt. Du är
 **självgående** 
 , kommunikativ, tar initiativ och har en god
 **samarbetsförmåga** 
 samt har
 **samt** 
 har förmågan att skapa goda relationer. Eftersom vi arbetar i en dynamisk miljö är det viktigt att du är
 **flexibel** 
 och snabbt kan anpassa dig till förändringar och nya möjligheter. Vi värdesätter även en positiv inställning samt en vilja att utvecklas i rollen och bidra till att skapa kundvärde.
   

  

**Praktisk Information**
* Programstart: September 2025
* Plats: Stockholm och Linköping
* Anställningsform: tillsvidare (6 månaders provanställning tillämpas)
* Omfattning: heltid
* Marknadsmässig ingångslön💰


**Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!**
*Denna rekrytering sker med löpande urval, varför vi gärna ser att du skickar din ansökan snarast, dock senast den 9/3.*
 Har du frågor om tjänsten eller ansökningsprocessen, vänligen kontakta rekryteringsteamet på recruitment@cambio.se.
   

  

 Cambio Healthcare Systems is Sweden’s leading suppliers of healthcare information systems and a growing player in the European market with just over 100,000 users across general and university hospitals, specialist units and outpatient units. Through the use of our integrated solutions, our customers provide services to 4 million patients.

title: Azure Arkitekt
description:
Då kan vi vara din framtida arbetsgivare!
   

  

 I rollen som Azure Cloud Arkitekt, kommer du att stödja våra kunder i deras Azure infrastrukturresor. Du blir en central figur, arbetandes tillsammans med våra tekniker, för att assistera kunderna från strategiutveckling till design och implementering av lösningar. Du blir en viktig stöttepelare för kunden i deras beslutsprocesser. I vårt dynamiska Cloud-team levererar ni tillsammans lösningar till kunder, där samarbete sker med allt från ledningsgrupper till supportteam.
   

  

 Vad vi ser efter i din bakgrund:
   

  

* Minst två års erfarenhet som konsult.
* Erfarenhet av arbete med infrastruktur, särskilt inom Azure eller andra molnlösningar.
* Vana av IT-infrastrukturarbeten.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska, i både tal och skrift, då det krävs i det dagliga arbetet.


 För att trivas som Azure Cloud Arkitekt hos oss, krävs en stark teknisk grund, förmågan att arbeta både självständigt och i team, samt skicklighet i att kommunicera tekniska idéer på ett klart och begripligt sätt. Din expertis är avgörande för att våra kunder får en robust, säker och skalbar molnmiljö som uppfyller deras behov.
   

  

 B3 Cloud, specialister på molnteknik och den digitala arbetsplatsen av morgondagen. Vi stöttar kunder i övergången från traditionell infrastruktur till molnet, erbjuder analyser, planering, migrering och hantering av IT-miljöer. Med ca 50 anställda och kontor i Stockholm och Göteborg, erbjuder vi expertstöd i form av konsulttjänster, agila projektleveranser och förvaltning genom vårt Technical Assistance Center (TAC).
   

  

 Intresserad? Om denna annons har fångat ditt intresse, tveka inte att ansöka! Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via e-post, men vid frågor, kontakta gärna Melinda på melinda.andersson@b3.se.
   

  

 Ytterligare förmåner som konsult hos oss:
   

  

* Konkurrenskraftiga löner.
* Flexibilitet i arbetslivet.
* Stor möjlighet till professionell utveckling.
* Interna utbildningar genom Cloud Skolan.
* Årliga konferensresor, sommar- och julfester.
* Regelbundna sociala aktiviteter, från After Works till frisbeekastning.


 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

*B3 Cloud, en del av B3-koncernen, har blivit utsedd till Sveriges tredje bästa arbetsplats 2021 av Great Place to Work, till Sveriges IT Karriärföretag 2022 och 2023, och vann utmärkelsen Årets Karriärföretag 2022. Våra värderingar är erfarenhet, mångfald och energi och vi arbetar för hållbarhet i allt vi gör. Vi tror att välmående medarbetare presterar bättre och har därför B3 Team, som arrangerar regelbundna wellness-aktiviteter, allt från yoga och löpning till musikquiz och föreläsningar om mental hälsa."*

title: Solution Architect Finance
description:
**SOLUTION ARCHITECT FINANCE**
 Would you like to work in an international environment where you’ll make a difference every day? At
 **Permobil** 
 , we’re looking for game-changers to join us as we innovate for individuals and develop the world’s most advanced assistive solutions.
   

  

 At Permobil, the people who use our products come first. Our purpose is to create advanced assistive solutions that make the lives of adults and children living with disabilities more enriching. Our people are passionate about pushing the boundaries of technology to deliver innovations that improve lives. We are a sustainable and responsible business committed to continuous improvement, and our customers can trust us to provide market-leading solutions driven by insights-based clinical data.
   

  

**Position Overview**
 We are seeking a skille d and experienced
 **Solution Architect Finance** 
 to join our team. As a Finance Architect, you will play a critical role in bridging business needs and IT solutions within the Finance domain. By proactively studying the business and understanding its requirements, you will propose and define both long-term strategic goals and short-term tactical plans. Your responsibilities will include researching, evaluating, and documenting potential solutions, whether off-the-shelf, in-house developed, or outsourced to third parties. Collaborating with business owners, you will identify the best-fit solutions and create detailed functional specifications, ensuring clear communication to development teams or external providers for successful implementation.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Design functional solutions based on business requirements, aligned with Permobil’s target architecture and frameworks
* Identify gaps in current systems and define strategies to bridge them,
* Guide projects on solution design decisions, assessing impacts and costs, while aligning with business priorities,
* Stay updated on industry trends to adopt best practices for improved efficiency and effectiveness,
* Ensure compliance with EA frameworks, covering quality, security, and other standards,
* Provide technical guidance and coaching to developers,
* Collaborate on contracts to ensure supplier commitments meet business needs and contractual obligations,
* Support daily operations through incident and change management as needed,
* Participate in area-specific projects, ensuring adherence to standard software validation procedures in partnership with stakeholders and compliance resources.


**Qualifications & Skills**
* University degree in IT, engineering or related discipline,
* Strong finance background with several years of Microsoft D365 Finance experience or similar,
* 2 or more years of working experience in a similar role,
* Well spoken and written English,
* Good knowledge of the business processes and system capabilities within the area,
* Good knowledge of system development methods and standards.


**Why is Permobil the next step for you?**
* You’ll make a difference. Every day. Everything we do leads to understanding and improving the lives of our users. Through our evidence-based innovation, we make a difference to people’s lives.
* You’ll make your mark as part of our future. We collaborate with colleagues across borders to Innovate for Individuals. The impact you make personally could lead change around the world.
* You’ll feel welcome from day one. We’re known for being great colleagues, who are collaborative, fun and at the cutting-edge. Everyone at Permobil cares as much as you do about making a positive difference.


**Application Process**
 We will conduct selection continuously so send us your application today or before
 **February 28th** 
 at the latest!
   

  

 Permobil is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals.
   

  

 For more information about the position, please contact Mats Weckberg, Director Enterprise Architecture, mats.weckberg@permobil.com
   

  

 For information about the recruitment process, please contact Zivile Mitkute, Talent Acquisition Partner, zivile.mitkute@permobil.com
   

  

**Please respect that we do not wish recruitment assistance or advertising, we decline calls from recruitment and advertising providers.**
**More About Permobil**
 Permobil founder Dr. Per Uddén believed that helping people achieve the greatest level of independence is a basic human right and, for over 50 years, Permobil has held fast to that belief. Permobil is a global leader in advanced rehabilitation technology, passionate about better understanding our users’ needs and improving their quality of life through state-of-the-art healthcare solutions. Today, those solutions include power wheelchairs, seating and positioning products, power assist, and manual wheelchairs.
   

  

 Permobil is part of Patricia Industries, a subsidiary of Investor AB, and is headquartered in Sweden. Permobil has 2 000 team members in 18 countries around the world. For more information regarding the company’s storied history and complete product line, visit permobil.com.

title: Content Designer - Hearts of Iron
description:
*Are you ready to conquer the world together with us? Do you want to be part of a humble and learning-focused team that has the players interest in mind? If you are ready to join us in the march towards the next level of Hearts of Iron, and have a strong experience of strategy games or wargames in general, we want you on our team!*
**Your mission**
 As a Content Designer on the Hearts of Iron team you will be a champion of the player experience, and work with the quality and feel of the game. You will be researching, designing, scripting, and writing engaging content for the game. Your work will have a direct impact on how Hearts of Iron is received and perceived by our fans.
   

  

 You will design and implement gameplay systems and experiences based on 20th century history. Together with the other Content Designers in the team, you will be designing and implementing historical narratives, and writing events in American English that thematically fit within the game. You will be researching related topics and creating believable non-historical storylines that use historical events as an inspiration.
   

  

**The Skills We’re Searching For…**
* An interest in Strategy games and History in general, especially in the Second World War era.
* Top notch writing skills, with an excellent command of American English.
* Experience in narrative design, game design, or experience performing similar tasks in the modding community.
* Experience in code-based scripting.


 You will be working in a team that values collaboration and cooperation. It’s important that you aren’t afraid to raise issues, and that you continuously look for improvement and try to inspire your colleagues. Since we are a fast-paced company, curiosity and an ability to get into things quickly are two important aspects.
   

  

 If you find it motivating to have freedom and the responsibility to take ownership of your task and deliver, but also know when to rely on others for support as well as being a supportive team member, then we’re looking forward to hearing your thoughts on how we can bring Hearts of Iron to the next level.
   

  

**Practical information**
 Scope: Full time and permanent
   

  

 Reports to: Design Manager
   

  

 Location: Stockholm
   

  

*We will not relocate for this position!*
 Today, Paradox consists of both publishing and internal game development. We have a broad portfolio of games and own the most important brands, including Stellaris, Europa Universalis, Hearts of Iron, Crusader Kings, Cities: Skylines, Prison Architect, Victoria, Age of Wonders and the World of Darkness catalog of brands.
   

  

 Since 2004, the company has published its games all over the world, initially through physical distribution but primarily in digital channels after 2006. Paradox games are developed primarily for PC and console platforms, but the company also releases games on mobile. The largest markets today include the US, UK, China, Germany, France and Scandinavia. In total, Paradox games have over five million players each month.

title: SAP-konsult, Stockholm
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Känner du dig nyfiken på nya utmaningar? Vill du jobba på en flexibel arbetsplats med spännande uppdrag inom SAP?
   

  

 Nu söker vi erfarna SAP-konsulter till vårt team i Stockholm, som är en del av vår nationella SAP Practice där vi jobbar tillsammans med SAP i fokus. Nu sker en renässans inom SAP med SAP S/4HANA, SAP Business Technology Platform, Embedded Analytics med mera. Det innebär att företag som använder SAP står inför helt nya utmaningar och möjligheter. Vill du vara med på denna resa?
   

  

 Välkommen till oss på CGI!
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 I rollen som SAP-konsult får du möjlighet att vara en viktig kugge i CGI:s leverans gentemot uppdragsgivare där du ingår i ett team med kunniga och erfarna kollegor. Här får du möjlighet att hjälpa våra kunder att effektivisera och utveckla sina affärsprocesser och systemlösningar med hjälp av de möjligheter SAP som affärssystem ger.
   

  

 Våra uppdrag finns inom till exempel ECC, CRM, S/4HANA, S/4HANA Cloud, SuccessFactors och User Experience. Här får du möjlighet att arbeta inom såväl implementationsprojekt, processförbättringar och förvaltningsuppdrag inom olika branscher så som Insurance, Retail och Manufacturing.
   

  

 Våra kunder befinner sig på olika stadier i sina resor mot S/4HANA. En del befinner sig redan i den nya tekniken, några har en pågående förändringsresa och andra har ännu inte tagit steget till den nya SAP-plattformen. Här kommer du spela en viktig roll i att guida våra kunder i deras förändringsresa.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Vi söker dig som redan är SAP-konsult eller har arbetat som SAP key user, och i rollen deltagit i eller drivit utvecklings- eller förändringsprojekt. Om du inte redan har arbetat med S/4HANA är det viktigt att du är nyfiken på det och vill göra en kompetensresa.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har följande:
   

  

* Relevant högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande
* Svenska och engelska obehindrad i tal och skrift


 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet eller ett brinnande intresse för ett eller flera av följande områden:
   

  

* Masterdata
* Finance
* Plan
* Source
* Make
* Deliver
* Security
* Analytics
* Technology
* ABAP
* Business Tech Platform (BTP)
* Integration, SAP Cloud Platform Intergration (CPI)
* RPA
* Machine learning
* User Experience (Fiori, Neptune)


**Mer information om tjänsten**
 För den här rollen lägger vi stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper. Rollen som konsult innebär en omväxlande vardag där du behöver ha en förmåga och drivkraft att bygga och utveckla goda relationer för att skapa ett starkt samarbete. För att framgångsrikt kunna lösa utmaningar som du och ditt team ställs inför söker vi dig med ett analytiskt tänk och kreativ problemlösningsförmåga. Du bör dessutom ha en affärsmässig inställning, ett stort eget driv och gilla utmaningar.
   

  

 CGI är ett av världens största oberoende tjänsteföretag inom IT och affärsprocesser och vi har ett nära samarbete med SAP som Guldpartner. CGI har även blivit utsedda till SAP Partner Of The Year de senaste två åren och är en av de största SAP-leverantörerna på den svenska marknaden.
   

  

**Vill du veta mer?**
 Vad bra! Sök till tjänsten redan nu då vi rekryterar löpande.
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Financial Accountant
description:
We’re a global team of over 400 people, working together to push the boundaries of open-source technology and multi-cloud solutions. Our vision is to become the trusted Data & AI Platform for everyone, leveraging the most popular open-source technologies like Apache Kafka®, Aiven for PostgreSQL®, Aiven for Clickhouse®, and Aiven for OpenSearch®. to help companies accelerate time-to-market, drive efficiency, and build innovative solutions across any cloud. Right now, we’re looking for a
 **Financial Accountant** 
 to join our team who shares our passion for forward-thinking and innovative approaches.
   

  

**Our values**
 We want individuals who can embody our values of ownership, courage, and openness.
   

  

 What does that mean in practice?
   

  

 We take ownership of the problems we solve. What we do is about improving life for our customers, enabling them to meet their goals. So we own our decisions and mistakes. Sometimes that takes courage. But we don’t falter – we take on challenges with confidence. And right at our heart is openness. We’re always open to new ideas – from wherever and whoever they come.
   

  

**The role:**
 Aiven is looking for an energetic and passionate accounting professional to strengthen the Accounting team, which consists of 10+ fantastic colleagues in Europe. The team is ambitious in developing processes and team competence to be best in class.
   

  

 We're seeking a motivated, proactive, and hands-on accounting professional with excellent teamwork and communication skills. The ideal candidate is a well-qualified accounting professional with a strong interest in accounting principles, financial control and process. We value a reliable team player, who enjoys working in a global, dynamic environment, wanting to seek improvements to processes, build strong relationships in and outside of finance and develop their career in a technology business.
   

  

 This position is based out of Helsinki (Aiven HQ) or Stockholm.
   

  

**What you'll do:**
* Contribute to the month-end close, including completing accounting activities, preparing and posting journal entries and calculating accounting concepts.
* Working on the accounting and financial reporting for a Group of 15 entities around the globe at the statutory entity level - the largest entities being in Finland and Germany.
* Ensure group accounting policies and principles are followed in all group entities.
* Working on the individual audits and preparation of financial statements for the subsidiary entities.
* Assisting the accounting team with ad hoc tasks and projects.
* Assisting with VAT returns and preparation of tax information.
* Work on projects to improve and automate accounting processes and systems within the finance landscape to enhance efficiency and operational excellence.
* Work with other internal teams, including accounting operations, tax & treasury, FP&A, legal, HR and IT.
* Work with and oversee some of our external advisors, including accounting and payroll partners in different jurisdictions, tax authorities, auditors and consultants.


**What we're looking for:**
* Minimum Bachelor's degree, and/or a recognized accounting qualification.
* Knowledge and practical understanding of accounting principles and standards (IFRS).
* 5+ years experience in accounting activities.
* Working knowledge of financial control and processes.
* Experience in tech or scale-ups is an advantage.
* Understanding as to how to prepare and post journal entries and experience with a recognised ERP system (NetSuite experience is a plus).
* Good communication skills and ability to work in a team.
* Ability to build professional networks within finance and cross-functional teams.
* Professional working proficiency in English (written and verbal).


 Don’t worry if your experience doesn’t line up perfectly – we still encourage you to apply! We believe in investing in our crabs’ professional growth.
   

  

**Our Offer**
 If you ask us what’s the best thing about working for Aiven, many will probably say it’s the high concentration of talent from around the world that we have here. Enjoy the agile environment of a hyperscale scale-up where you can truly make an impact and have fun while at it.
   

  

**We invest in you**
* Participate in Aiven’s equity plan.
* With Aiven locations spanning the globe, we want all of our crabs to find the right balance with our hybrid work policy.
* Get the equipment you need to set yourself up for success.
* Step up your career game with real employer support (annual learning budget, and more).
* Get holistic wellbeing support through our global Employee Assistance Program.


**Make a difference at Aiven**
* Contribute to open source projects that you find meaningful outside of work - and get paid for it! Our Plankton program recognizes extra work to the open source ecosystem for developers and non-developers alike.
* Use up to 5 days per year to volunteer for a good cause of your choice.
* Join one of our team member resource groups - empower yourself and others in missions that resonate with you.


**What else?**
 Need insurance? We’ve got you covered - benefit from our travel insurance.
   

  

**Amazing! What’s next?**
 If you think Aiven is the place for you, send us your CV, and we’ll get in touch!
   

  

**How To Recognise And Avoid Employment Scams**
 There has been a rise in fake job postings used by scammers to get personal information. Please familiarise yourself with the red flags of a potential scam.
   

  

 Here at Aiven, all of our emails relating to recruitment come from an @aiven.io, @greenhouse.io or @eu.greenhouse.io domain and all of our interviews are conducted over video call or in person, our interviews will never occur over text or chat. If you’re unsure of the legitimacy of a job opportunity/offer pertaining to Aiven, please don’t hesitate to reach out to us at recruitment@aiven.io.
   

  

**Equal Opportunities**
 Aiven provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified employees and applicants for employment without regard to age, gender identity, national or ethnic origin, religion, sexual orientation, physical and mental ability, marital and family status or without regard to any other similar personal attributes. Aiven complies with applicable local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company operates. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, training and any other terms and conditions related to employment.
   

  

 At Aiven we are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities or special needs in our working environment and job application procedures. We make all reasonable accommodations for persons with disabilities or who otherwise need support to thrive in the workplace. We are committed to continuously improving workplace accessibility. There is an option to request a discussion in the application process but if you have any questions before applying please write to us at recruitment@aiven.io.

title: Senior Talent Acquisition Partner - Sales
description:
**Job Description**
*Are you an experienced talent acquisition professional with a passion for building teams in close collaboration with your hiring managers? Does being part of one of Europe’s fastest growing companies interest you? If so, then we’d love to chat!*
**Role background**
 Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops’ goods delivered to your home or to the office. We were founded in 2014 and today team members across 25 countries, servicing over 20 million registered users. In June 2022, we joined forces with DoorDash.
   

  

 Our Talent Acquisition team has been on an incredible journey throughout this time too. We’re now a global team of 130+, based across multiple European countries, Tokyo and Tel Aviv. As part of our phenomenal growth, we are now looking for an experienced
 **Talent Acquisition Partner - Sales** 
 to join our business talent acquisition team, responsible for finding exceptional talent for our sales organisation.
   

  

 As a
 **Senior Talent Acquisition Partner - Sales** 
 , you’ll be owning the end-to-end recruitment process while managing the relationships with your key stakeholders and always putting candidate experience and quality of hire at the heart of everything you do.
   

  

 This is a great opportunity for someone who is passionate about the future of recruitment, and wants to develop and improve hiring processes together with Wolt’s business leaders, as well as impact strategic initiatives such as diversity attraction, market mapping of talent for new hubs, geographical expansion projects and more.
   

  

**What You'll Be Doing**
 Are you ready to take the helm in shaping our sales recruitment strategy? As the project lead for our hiring teams, you will craft and execute a robust hiring roadmap. You'll streamline processes and train interviewers, ensuring our team is equipped for success.
   

  

* Be the Go-To Expert: Leverage your experience and market insights to provide invaluable guidance to our hiring managers. Your well-informed data points and market understanding will help steer our recruitment efforts in the right direction.
* Pipeline Building: Champion a sourcing-first approach to build evergreen candidate pipelines for our sales roles to provide every candidate with an exceptional interview experience that showcases the best of what we offer.
* Think Big and Bold: Sales talent is tough to attract, but with your expertise in employer branding, online and offline marketing, you'll design and execute large-scale campaigns that captivate top talent.
* Data-Driven Decision Maker: Utilise talent acquisition tools and reporting to optimise our recruiting funnel, to increase candidate pass-through ratios, eliminate bottlenecks, and enhance KPIs such as monthly fill rate, time to hire, and cost per hire.
* Innovate and Excel: Constantly seek out new and innovative methods to attract the best global talent. Your dedication to recruiting best practices will set us apart in the competitive landscape.
* Collaborate and Conquer: Work closely with your sub-team and the broader TA team, sharing ideas, successes, and solutions to overcome hiring challenges. Together, we’ll build a strong and dynamic recruitment process.


**Our humble expectations**
* Experienced Recruitment Advisor: With several years of sales recruitment experience under your belt, you thrive on leading processes and offering strategic advice. You're not just a recruiter; you're a trusted advisor and a leader.
* Talent Pooling Pro: You've successfully managed talent pools, evergreen roles, and ongoing pipelines for continuous hiring. Your proactive approach ensures we always have top talent ready to join our team.
* Champion of Candidate Experience: Candidate experience is at the heart of everything you do. You make decisions with the candidate’s journey in mind, ensuring a positive and memorable experience.
* Global Team Player: You flourish in a fast-paced, international environment, collaborating with colleagues from around the world. You tackle bottlenecks head-on, ensuring smooth and efficient processes.
* Clear Communicator: Your communication skills are top-notch, both verbally and in writing. You engage effectively in English, ensuring everyone is on the same page.
* Data-Driven Recruiter: You value the power of data and believe in transparency. Sharing pipeline metrics and crucial data with your hiring teams is second nature to you, driving informed decisions and continuous improvement.


**Next Steps**
 If you are creative, like moving fast, and thrive in a dynamic environment where you get to be proactive and figure out what to do (rather than wait to be told) – then apply today.
   

  

 What you’ll get by joining us
   

  

* Opportunity to be part of building something exceptional, in an international environment.
* Lots of learning and growth in a globally scaling tech company.
* Along with a competitive salary and benefits, you will also be eligible for our long term incentive plan.


 Please note that we do not accept applications sent by email. You should submit your application through our careers website!
   

  

**About Wolt**
 Wolt is a Helsinki-based technology company that provides an online platform for consumers, merchants and couriers. It connects people looking to order food and other goods with people interested in selling and delivering them. To enable this, Wolt develops a wide range of technologies from local logistics to retail software and financial solutions – as well as operating its own grocery stores under the Wolt Market brand. Wolt’s products include Wolt+ (subscription service for customers), Wolt for Work (meal benefits and office deliveries for companies), Wolt Drive (fast last-mile deliveries for merchants) and Wolt Self-Delivery (service for merchant partners with their own delivery staff). Wolt’s mission is to make cities better by empowering and growing local communities. Wolt was founded in 2014 and joined forces with DoorDash in 2022. DoorDash operates in 29 countries today, 25 of which are with the Wolt product and brand.
   

  

**So, why work at Wolt?**
**At Wolt, We’re About Getting Things Done.**
 You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.
   

  

 We work hard to make cities into better places, and it’s pretty cool seeing us grow every week. If you’re passionate about building things that just… work, Wolt might be for you.
   

  

**Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion**
 We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.
   

  

 Join us today to build Wolt together.

title: SAP Architect
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 CGI is a global IT and business consulting services firm that delivers high-quality services and solutions to clients around the world. We are committed to helping our clients achieve their business goals through innovative technology and exceptional service.
   

  

 In the Swedish market, we are one of the largest SAP providers, with an active and national SAP Practice where we share knowledge and experiences with each other.
   

  

 We look forward to your application!
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced SAP Architect to join our Financial Services unit in Stockholm. As an SAP Architect, you will play a crucial role in designing, implementing, and optimizing SAP solutions to meet the unique needs of our clients.
   

  

 Your future duties and responsibilities:
   

  

* Lead the design and architecture of SAP solutions for financial services clients.
* Collaborate with clients to understand their business requirements and translate them into effective SAP solutions.
* Provide technical leadership and guidance to project teams.
* Ensure the integration of SAP solutions with other enterprise systems.
* Conduct system analysis and performance tuning to ensure optimal system performance.
* Stay up-to-date with the latest SAP technologies and industry trends.


 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

* Extensive experience in SAP architecture and implementation, particularly in the financial services sector, with at least 7 years of relevant professional experience.
* Proven success in business development and client relationship management within the Swedish market
* Strong knowledge of SAP modules such as FI, CO, and TRM.
* Proven experience in leading SAP projects and teams and the ability to work cross-functionally.
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Experience in solutioning & pre-sales is preferred
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
* Relevant academic background
* Fluency in English, both spoken and written


 You also have a drive to build and develop relationships, are skilled at seeing the big picture and details as well as understanding new contexts. As a person, it is therefore important that you work well in collaboration with others, are responsive, helpful, and like to challenge yourself. When you work, you are an analytical and creative problem solver, you are meticulous and can handle complex problems.
   

  

 Want to know more?
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you! Please send in your application as soon as possible, and if there is still something you are wondering about, feel free to contact Johanna Havervall, Talent Acquisition Manager 073-6176474, Johanna.havervall@cgi.com.
   

  

**Personal Safety Requirements May Be Required.**
**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Account Executive
description:
**Join Our Scaleup Journey & Fuel Your Curiosity!**
 At Lime Go, a thriving scaleup under Lime Technologies Sweden AB (publ), you’ll be part of a fast-moving, entrepreneurial team with the backing of a successful, publicly listed company. It's the best of both worlds – the agility of a startup and the stability of an industry leader with a proven track record of success.
   

  

**Who We’re Looking For 🤓**
* 2+ years of experience selling complex products/services (bonus if SaaS!)
* A curiosity-driven, growth-oriented mindset ready to scale with us
* Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills
* Sharp problem-solving abilities


**Your Role in Our Team 👨🏻‍🤝‍👨🏻**
* Own the entire sales process, from prospecting to closing and handover
* Target ideal customers across industries and regions
* Get creative with omnichannel outreach and inbound leads to build your pipeline
* Tailor our Data-driven Sales CRM to fit each customer’s needs – demo both online and in-person
* Negotiate to win larger deals faster, smashing your sales goals in the process


**The Product 🤑**
 Lime Go is a Data-Enriched Sales CRM built for SMBs in the Nordics. You’ll be selling to sales teams who understand the value of what we offer. With over 1,000 customers in Sweden, Norway, and Denmark, our aim is to become the top choice for ambitious companies across Europe.
   

  

 We’ve just completed a full product revamp, making Lime Go a fresh, modern, and powerful tool for your customers.
   

  

**The Lime Go Team 👨🏻‍🤝‍👨🏻**
 We’re a close-knit, ambitious team of 18 with bold growth goals for the coming years. We’re looking for a cornerstone player like you to help make it happen.
   

  

**Requirements**
**Skills & Requirements** 
**Requirements**
* Bachelor’s degree 🎓
* Driver's license 🚙
* Willing to work from our office in Stockholm 🎈
* Fluent in Swedish and English 🎭
* A proven track record of sales excellence 📈


 You’ll report to Max (Sales Manager & Director) and have weekly 1-on-1s, plus collaborate with our 11-member Revenue Operations team (Sales, CS, Product - all in Stockholm!).
   

  

**Perks & Benefits 💸**
* Competitive base salary with performance-based commissions (with kicker levels!)
* 6 weeks of vacation, company conferences and parties, wellness allowance, pension, and more
* A fun, collaborative environment with regular team activities and laughs


**The Application Process 💻**
* Screening call with the team
* Interview
* Case assignment to pitch our product
* In-depth interview(s) with team members
* Reference check
* Agreement walkthrough
* Final interview with Lime Group’s CEO (Nils)


 Don’t wait – apply now and start your journey with us. Europe is ready for Lime Go. Are you?
   

  

 Let’s Go! 🚀

title: Music Partnerships Manager (Tiktok & Youtube Music)
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture.** 
**Come join us—and let the world feel your work.**
**As a DSP Key Account Manager with focus on Tiktok and Youtube Music, you will play a crucial role in the Music department, reporting into the Head of Commercial Music Partnerships. This is a full-time position located at our headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden.**
**Job Summary:**
 As Key Account Manager, DSP Partnerships, you will be responsible for meeting target KPIs on Tiktok, Youtube Music (including our Youtube music channels) and other accounts assigned to you, in order to generate sales and growth for our catalog. The accounts represent our most valued business partners within the segment, and you will manage both strategy and relationships with the DSPs and make sure we act with operational excellence. You will pitch and promote our catalog in line with department and overall company strategy, with the aim of ensuring maximum impact of our releases on the platforms.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Manage and nurture relationships with our Tiktok, Youtube Music and other partners, ensuring that our catalog receives the attention it deserves by executing on playlisting and other programming opportunities. You will also manage the work with Epidemic Sound’s own YouTube Music channels
* Through both direct interactions and the utilization of platform tools, you'll work with our releases effectively, maximizing revenue and visibility
* Beyond managing existing partnerships, you'll actively seek out and cultivate new relationships with music partners globally. This expansion will be instrumental in increasing our reach and driving growth
* Make sure to timely report performance metrics for the accounts assigned
* Be a strong user of data and take actions based on these insights to improve streams, visibility, and revenue of the catalog on DSPs
* Maintain strong knowledge of the streaming landscape and make sure to communicate information internally
* Contribute to team OKRs to ensure initiatives, processes, and programs are achieved
* Stay up to date with trends and best practices within the field
* Work as an internal liaison between relevant stakeholders in order to ensure we deliver according to deal terms and meet set goals
* Support improvement of partnership productivity focused on implementation and reporting standardization


**Requirements:**
* In-depth knowledge of the music industry
* 5+ years industry experience, and 2+ years working in a similar position with Tiktok/Bytedance and/or Youtube
* Proven track record of growing revenues through key account management
* In-depth knowledge of a broad range of musical genres
* In-depth knowledge of the leading digital music platforms, with focus on Tiktok and Youtube
* Solid understanding of sales strategy and how it can be used to strengthen platform performance
* Proven track record of working with more complex analytical tasks to maximize results


**Preferred Qualifications/ Bonus Skills:**
* Detailed oriented - Ensures information is complete and accurate
* Strong organizing, administration and structured skills
* High initiative skills - Identifies opportunities and issues, and proactively acts and follows through on work activities to capitalize or resolve them
* Highly skilled in prioritizing - Plans and organizes work activities; manages several tasks at once


**Equal Opportunity Employer:**
 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
   

  

**Application**
 Do you want to be a part of our fantastic team? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link below.
   

  

**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.**

title: Senior konsult inom Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations till Utility-sektorn
description:
*Vill du vara med och bidra till att våra kunder inom energibranschen blir ännu nöjdare? Och hjälpa till att förenkla för våra kunder i deras dagliga verksamhet? Då kan det här vara jobbet du väntat på!*
 För att våra kunder ska kunna möta energimarknadens förändringar på ett effektivt sätt är vikten av moderna system- och tjänstleveranser avgörande. På EG har vi höga ambitioner för framtiden och är ledande i branschen.
   

  

**Utveckla energibranschen med oss och Xellent**
 Nu behöver vi förstärka vårt team med ytterligare en konsult med fokus på Microsoft Dynamics 365FOs kund-, leverantörsreskontra och huvudbok, som ska arbeta med ett av Nordens största fakturerings- och kundinformationssystem för energibranschen – Xellent. Ditt fokus kommer att vara att leverera digitaliserade IT-lösningar för framtidens energibolag till våra kunder.
   

  

 Som seniorkonsult inom EG kommer du att arbeta i ett team mot våra nuvarande och blivande kunder inom Utility-sektorn. Vi arbetar med stort kundfokus och hög servicenivå för att tillsammans uppnå den absolut bästa IT-lösningen för våra kunder. Vår huvudlösning är branschlösningen Xellent, baserad på Microsoft Dynamics 365FO.
   

  

 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med placering kopplat till något av våra kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg eller Malmö. Koncernspråket inom EG är engelska.
   

  

 Exempel på arbetsuppgifter som förekommer där du också kommer att driva under eget ansvar är;
   

  

* Kravhantering från behov till implementerad funktion
* Processanalyser i syfte att säkerställa att kunderna nyttjar våra lösningar på ett optimalt sätt
* Projekt- och konsultarbete hos kund
* Medverka i säljaktiviteter tillsammans med våra säljare och övriga konsulter
* Agera support och stöd för våra kunder


**Du är den ideala kandidaten om du:**
 Har förmåga och intresse att förstå kundens behov och brinner för att ge bästa tänkbara service. Du har vana att arbeta självständigt och ta ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter. Som person är du utåtriktad, strukturerad och uttrycker dig tydligt i både tal och skrift.
   

  

 Vidare är du intresserad av att förstå helheten av vår leverans kopplat till våra kunders processer. Du har ett driv och nyfikenhet att ständigt vilja utvecklas och förbättra våra leveranser.
   

  

 Vi ser också att du har tidigare erfarenhet inom finansområdet med fokus på kund-, leverantörsreskontra och huvudbok i Microsoft Dynamics 365. Har du dessutom erfarenhet av Electronic Reporting är det ett stort plus.
   

  

**Vad kan du förvänta dig av oss?**
* En professionell men informell miljö med närhet till våra kunder
* Stöd av erfarna kollegor som vet att framgång nås genom samarbete och erfarenhetsutbyte
* Goda utvecklingsmöjligheter
* Möjlighet till distansarbete på deltid
* En trivsam arbetsmiljö med marknadsmässig lön och villkor
* Ett starkt partnerskap med Microsoft genom vårt samarbete som Gold Certified Partner


 Tillsammans utgör vi ett ambitiöst och informellt team där det finns utrymme för mångfald och respekt för olikheter. Därmed kan vi kan ha kul tillsammans när vi arbetar hårt med att uppfylla kundernas behov på en robust och branschspecifik programvara. Läs mer på eg.se.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig.
   

  

**Kontakt**
 Vill du veta mer om rollen innan du söker, är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Marina Klinglöf på telefon +46 1 019 55 167 eller e-post makli@eg.se. Vi går igenom ansökningar löpande och anställer så snart vi hittat rätt kandidat. Skicka därför din ansökan snarast möjligt. Alla ansökningar hanteras konfidentiellt.
   

  

 Hos EG utvecklar vi programvara för våra kunder så att de kan fokusera på sitt yrke. Vår branschspecifika programvara är utvecklad av branschexperter och stöds av EGs resurser för stabilitet, innovation och säkerhet. Vi är dedikerade till att stärka branscher genom att möta stora utmaningar som resursanvändning, effektivitet och hållbarhet.
   

  

 Bli en del av oss och bidra till att skapa programvara som arbetar för människor, inte tvärtom.
   

  

 Läs mer om EG. Besök på vår karriärsida, där du också kan se två inspirerande videor: en där fyra av våra engagerade kollegor ger dig en inblick i deras arbete på EG, och en annan om hur vi gör skillnad.

title: Engineering Manager in Back End (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more . Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**Get to Know our Team:**
 In Agoda’s Back End Engineering department, we build the scalable, fault-tolerant systems and APIs that host our core business logic. Our systems cover all major areas of our business: inventory and pricing, product information, customer data, communications, partner data, booking systems, payments, and more. These mission-critical systems change frequently with dozens of releases per day, so we must employ state-of-the-art CI/CD and testing techniques in order to make sure everything works without any downtime. We also ensure that our systems are self-healing, responding gracefully to extreme loads or unexpected input. In order to accomplish this, we use state-of-the-art languages like Scala and Go, data technologies like Kafka and Aerospike, and agile development practices. Most importantly though, we hire great people from all around the world and empower them to be successful. Whether it’s building new projects like Flights and Packages or reimagining our existing business, you’ll make a big impact as part of the Back End Engineering team.
   

  

**The Opportunity:**
 The Engineering Manager role at Agoda is one of the most significant and challenging roles at the company. The right candidate is both extremely hands on – technically excellent, with solid engineering principles – and exhibits strong leadership and people development skills. We are looking for world class development managers to lead one or more of our engineering teams.
   

  

**In this Role, you’ll get to:**
* Be hands on – its one of the job’s fundamental task, and most of our development managers are writing and reviewing code, giving expert level coaching and guidance to their engineers.
* It’s important to have a love of engineering and a passion for building things elegantly and at scale. Staying in touch with where the industry is going is crucial, and it’s important to have strong opinions about how systems should be architected, engineered, and maintained
* Do full stack engineering: you should have solid experience in all parts of the technology stack: infrastructure, client side, back end, performance, data, and others.
* Developing people – Despite our investment and belief in technology, people are still our greatest asset. The right candidate will have a keen interest in developing people: inspiring those around them so they can achieve their potential. Being able to bring A-players such as yourself from outside and integrating them into the business will also be important.


**What you’ll Need to Succeed** 
**:**
* Extremely proficient in at least 1 programming language (Java, Scala, C#)
* Strong experience in systems architecture – particularly in complex, scalable and fault tolerant distributed systems
* Demonstrable experience as a system owner with operational responsibility
* Proficient in lower level engineering (Garbage collection, context switching, threading)
* DevOps culture – Agility. Leanness. Automation. CI/CD
* Good understanding of application security
* Passionate about technology and the Internet
* Must have worked in a successful agile development team
* Must have run engineering teams before with 5+ direct reports
* Able to operate with autonomously: making decisions, setting KPIs, with a strong sense of ownership
* Practices data driven decision making


**It’s Great if you have:**
* Proficiency in more than one programming language


 #sanjose #losangeles #sydney #melbourne #perth #brussels #saopaolo #vancouver #shanghai #beijing #shenzhen #copenhagen #helsinki #paris #hongkong #budapest #jakarta #dublin #telaviv #milan #rome #tokyo #kualalumpur #amsterdam #oslo #jerusalem #manila #moscow #barcelona #madrid #stockholm #zurich #taipei #istanbul #london #wroclaw #warsaw #rio #chennai #pune #toronto #austin #sydney #chichago #noida #delhi #seattle #hyderabad #gurgaon #newyork #bangalore #boston #bengaluru #berlin #mumbai #stockholm #barcelona #IT #4 #5
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation.
