Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .
   

  

 To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: Legal Counsel
description:
**This is what makes the position as Legal Counsel stimulating**
* Be at the forefront of tech innovation and compliance: Join a legal team shaping the regulatory framework for the latest EU regulations like the GDPR, AI Act, and Data Act.
* Thrive in a collaborative and dynamic environment: Work with a diverse, multinational team passionate about privacy, AI, and data, where continuous learning and knowledge sharing are prioritised.
* Accelerate your professional growth: Embrace opportunities for development in a role that balances autonomy with team-driven success in navigating complex legal challenges.


 My name is Jimmy Sixmar, and I am the Head of Privacy & Corporate Affairs. As a leader, I am deeply committed to fostering the growth and success of every team member, empowering individuals while building a strong, collaborative team that thrives together.
   

  

 Read more about life at Dustin here
   

  

**Your role & influence as Legal Counsel**
***Responsibility* 
 :** 
 You will be given responsibility for advising on EU regulations and developing, implementing, and maintaining a robust compliance framework to support the company’s tech and regulatory governance.
   

  

***Collaboration:***
 Together with your team, you take care of regulatory tech governance, ensuring compliance and innovation align seamlessly. You'll work closely not only with your immediate team members but also with departments such as Business Development, E-commerce, Tech, Procurement, and HR.
   

  

**Core Activities**
* Investigate legal issues and provide expert guidance, coaching, and direct support on EU regulations and data compliance to ensure alignment with evolving legal requirements across the business.
* Develop, enhance, and maintain a comprehensive legal framework for data compliance, driving proactive governance and adaptability in a rapidly changing regulatory landscape.
* Promote awareness and foster a culture of compliance by sharing knowledge, conducting training, and serving as a trusted advisor to the business on complex legal and regulatory challenges.


****This is what we imagine you bring****
 We envision you as a curious and driven individual who thrives in dynamic environments, eager to tackle new tech regulations and contribute meaningfully to a forward-thinking legal team.
   

  

**Additionally, It's Important That**
* You have a bachelor's degree level of working and thinking, with a European law degree.
* You have senior experience of working with EU regulations such as the GDPR, NIS Directive, AI Act, or the Data Act.
* You bring an understanding of and interest in technology related to legal compliance and data governance.
* You are fluent in English, with the ability to effectively perform your work entirely in English.


****What can you expect next?****
 To Ensure a Fair Recruitment Process Free From Unconscious Bias, We Handle Your Application Anonymously And Do Not Accept Cover Letters. Please Refrain From Sending One, So That The Selection Is Based Solely On Professional Competencies. We Expect The Following Steps In The Recruitment Process
   

  

* Telephone screening with Talent Acquisition Partner Ida Wannebro
* 1st interview with hiring manager Jimmy Sixmar
* Assessments
* 2nd interview with Jimmy Sixmar & General Counsel Charlotte Törnberg.
* Background check
* References


**Read More About How To Become a Dustineer**
 For questions about the position, please contact the TA Partner Ida Wannebro (ida.wannebro@dustin.com).

title: Senior Casualty Underwriter
description:
Interested in joining one of the largest insurance companies in the world?
   

  

 We are looking for a Nordic Senior Underwriter to join our Nordic Casualty UW operation. The role is based at our office in Stockholm and will report directly to our Nordic Head of Casualty.
   

  

 The team operates across all Nordic countries and Baltics and work closely with cluster distribution and commercial claims teams. The team consist of twelve underwriters located across the Nordic cluster, operating with products in both general liability (GL) and environmental (EIL). The Nordic team works closely with our UW specialist hubs across Europe, in both GL and EIL.
   

  

**Job description:**
 Successful individual will operate across both Casualty fields (GL and EIL) and together with the rest of the team, be in close contact with major clients and brokers across the Nordic region and to some extent the Baltic region. The job will also include supporting the younger part of the team in their UW development.
   

  

**Business Management**
* Monitoring and managing multiple distribution channels, partnerships, and brokers across the Nordic region
* Handling of large, multinational and complex accounts
* Ensuring successful execution of product development and underwriting (both GL and EIL)
* Measuring and reporting on operational issues, opportunities and development plans against company objectives
* Driving continuous operational improvement projects


**External Relationship Management**
* Representing AIG to major clients and brokers across the Nordic regio
* Expand and enhance the AIG Casualty brand across the region


**What we’re looking for:**
 We are looking for a senior professional who have many years of experience in the casualty UW field, potentially experience in both the EIL & GL. You are well connected in the region and enjoying building strong relationships in the various markets along with delivering strong UW excellence.
   

  

 In short:
   

  

  

* Senior UW track record in Casualty or/and EIL
* A “natural” with clients who can represent AIG effectively and support the introduction, establishment, and growth of valuable client relationships across Nordic market
* Proven ability to manage a broad range of stakeholders.
* Highly collaborative approach across functions and countries.
* Good communication skills in both English and a Nordic language
* Relevant University degree


 If you have any questions about the position or the recruitment process, please contact;
   

  

  

* Fredrik Forsström, Nordic General Manager, +46 704 19 40 81, fredrik.forsstrom@aig.com
* Alexander Sjöberg, HR Manager - +46 850692014 , Alexander.Sjoberg@aig.com


 American International Group, Inc. (AIG) is a leading global insurance organization. Building on 100 years of experience, today AIG member companies provide a wide range of property casualty insurance, life insurance, retirement solutions, and other financial services to customers in more than 80 countries and jurisdictions. These diverse offerings include products and services that help businesses and individuals protect their assets, manage risks and provide for retirement security.
   

  

**Reimagining insurance to make a bigger difference to the world**
 American International Group, Inc. (AIG) is a global leader in commercial and personal insurance solutions; we are one of the world’s most far-reaching property casualty networks. It is an exciting time to join us — across our operations, we are thinking in new and innovative ways to deliver ever-better solutions to our customers. At AIG, you can go further to support individuals, businesses, and communities, helping them to manage risk, respond to times of uncertainty and discover new potential. We invest in our largest asset, our people, through continuous learning and development, in a culture that celebrates everyone for who they are and what they want to become.
   

  

**Welcome to a culture of belonging**
 We’re committed to creating a culture that truly respects and celebrates each other’s talents, backgrounds, cultures, opinions and goals. We foster a culture of inclusion and belonging through our flexible work arrangements, diversity and inclusion learning, cultural awareness activities and Employee Resource Groups (ERGs). With global chapters, ERGs are a cornerstone for our culture of inclusion. The diversity of our people is one of AIG’s greatest assets, and we are honored that our drive for positive change has been recognized by numerous recent awards and accreditations.
   

  

*AIG provides equal opportunity to all qualified individuals regardless of race, color, religion, age, gender, gender expression, national origin, veteran status, disability or any other legally protected categories.*
 AIG is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to job applicants and employees with disabilities. If you believe you need a reasonable accommodation, please send an email to candidatecare@aig.com.

title: Senior Legal Counsel
description:
**Job ID: 28508**
 We are now looking for a permanent Senior Legal Counsel to strengthen our Swedish Legal team. The role is based in Stockholm, Sweden. Join one of Sweden’s leading retail banks, where we proudly maintain high People Pulse scores thanks to our inclusive culture and commitment to employee well-being.
   

  

**About Our Team**
 Our role is to provide legal advice on matters relating to private customers. You will be part of a team with six lawyers who are based in Stockholm, and report to Head of Personal Banking Legal SE.
   

  

 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
**Main responsibilities in this role is to:**
* Provide legal and commercial advice on matters relating to private customer banking products
* Product development, mainly payments and accounts
* Handle customer complaints and litigation
* Daily support to the branches and Customer Service
* Implementation of new regulations relating to consumers


**Who You Are**
**Your background and skills include:**
* Master’s degree in Law
* Experience of legal matters related to consumers, for example payments (PSD2)
* At least five years’ relevant experience from a similar position at a bank, Finansinspektionen or law firm
* Swedish and English skills, in spoken and written (Professional level), since all communication will be in both languages


**It would be ideal if you also:**
* Have experience within Legal Design


 If this sounds like you, let’s get in touch!
   

  

****Next steps****
 Submit your application no later than 24/02/2025. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Homan Hamzeh, Head of PeB Legal SE, at homan.hamzeh@nordea.com.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 People come here when they want to get somewhere. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.
   

  

**A culture that fosters performance and growth** 
 in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.
   

  

**Hybrid working model** 
 – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.
   

  

**Diversity and inclusion are a natural part of our daily work.** 
 We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.

title: Manager, Loyalty Specialist Sales, Services Business Development (Swedish speaking)-R-235452
company_industry: Financial Services, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**Our Purpose**
*Mastercard powers economies and empowers people in 200+ countries and territories worldwide. Together with our customers, we’re helping build a sustainable economy where everyone can prosper. We support a wide range of digital payments choices, making transactions secure, simple, smart and accessible. Our technology and innovation, partnerships and networks combine to deliver a unique set of products and services that help people, businesses and governments realize their greatest potential.*
**Title And Summary**
 Manager, Loyalty Specialist Sales, Services Business Development (Swedish speaking)
   

  

 Who is Mastercard?
   

  

 Mastercard Loyalty Solutions is the world's largest loyalty company, a service division within Mastercard that provides reward programs, offers, and benefits to both financial institutions and merchants. We manage over 600 million accounts on our loyalty systems, serving over 2000 global clients. We offer an end-to-end outsourced service and are at the forefront of next-generation loyalty solutions, including Personalized Card Linked Offers and Pay with Reward Points. Our global team consists of 900 loyalty specialists working across the world, leading the integration of loyalty with payments.
   

  

**Overview**
 We are seeking a dynamic issuer business development professional to identify loyalty sales opportunities among financial institutions in Northern European division (Netherlands, Baltics and Nordics countries). Working alongside the broader Mastercard sales and account teams, you will specialize in creating compelling propositions for clients using our diverse range of loyalty solutions. Additionally, you will collaborate with solution architects to sell complex loyalty platforms and programs. This position is an individual contributor role.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Sell loyalty solutions and services to financial institutions in the Northern European region (including and not limited to new and emerging banks, fintechs, merchants and acquirers).
* Assist banks in redefining their loyalty strategies to achieve better business results by transitioning to a Mastercard loyalty solution.
* Develop persuasive sales narratives, technical solutions, and client loyalty/commercial loyalty models. Demonstrate expertise when presenting to clients during pitches and workshops.
* Support markets objectives by tailoring and deploying solutions on a market wide basis when possible.
* Facilitate deal closures through contracting and pricing approvals.
* Provide client and market feedback loop to internal functions (e.g. product, marketing) on tools and programs


**All About You**
* Undergraduate degree required; MBA or relevant post graduate degree recommended.
* You have hands-on experience in Platform / SaaS sales or/ and sales in the financial services industry (merchant sales experience is a plus).
* You have the ability to communicate complex ideas effectively – both verbally and in writing –in English and in Swedish. Additional Nordic language is an advantage.
* You are a dynamic and ambitious sales expert with high energy.
* You possess excellent relationship management skills, presentation skills, a good level of financial and technical acumen, and extensive experience in loyalty and loyalty program management. Preferably, with a consultative sales approach.


 #servicesbd
   

  

**Corporate Security Responsibility**
 All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:
   

  

* Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
* Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
* Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
* Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

title: Senior Underwriting Specialist Property Nordics
description:
**Senior Underwriter inom Egendomsförsäkring**
 Vill du bygga en framgångsrik på AIG och arbeta med ett motiverat team som strävar efter att bli världsledande inom försäkring?
   

  

 Teamet växer och vi söker nu efter en Senior Underwriting Specialist för att stärka vårt nordiska Commercial-Property-team, med fokus på stora och komplexa multinationella kunder. Tjänsten är baserad på vårt kontor i centrala Stockholm.
   

  

 I rollen som Senior Underwriting Specialist kommer huvudfokus vara underwriting och hantering av stora, komplexa skador. Du kommer bygga och upprätthålla långsiktiga relationer med externa och arbeta inom fastställda riktlinjer och underwriting-standarder. Som Senior Underwriting Specialist samarbetar du även i teamet och bidrar till utbildning a juniora underwriters. UW teamet samarbetar på daglig basis med både vårt existerande skadeteam samt med våra riskingenjörer.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

  

* Omfattande erfarenhet av egendomsförsäkring, då antingen som underwriter och/eller som försäkringsmäklare
* 
* Lång erfarenhet av att hantera multinationella & komplexa egendomskonton
* 
* Förmåga att bygga starka relationer med försäkringsmäklare och kunder
* 
* Djup kunskap om egendomsförsäkring, återförsäkring och portföljhantering
* 
* Flytande engelska och ett skandinaviskt språk i tal och skrift


- 

 Intresserad? Kul! Vänligen skicka in din ansökan via vår karriärportal. Vi ser gärna att din ansökan är på engelska.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kring positionen, processen eller AIG är du välkommen att kontakta:
   

  

  

* Mikko Ollila, Head of Commercial Property Nordics – +358 50 546 5449, mikko.ollila@aig.com

title: Swedish Speaking SEO Content Editor
description:
* Fully Remote Position
* Permanent or Full-time Contractor
* Competitive Package


**About Us**
 ClickOut Media is not just a company - it's a thriving ecosystem of diverse talent from around the globe. As a proudly remote-first organisation, we've cultivated an environment where creativity flourishes, collaboration is core, and innovation knows no bounds. With over +850 team members and more than 200 assets, our startup culture fuels our growth, making us a leading force in multi-channel marketing. We specialise in delivering best-in-class SEO & Content solutions to esteemed clients worldwide.
   

  

**What Makes Us Different**
 At ClickOut Media, we thrive in the most competitive search verticals, operate across every major language, and conquer platforms you've probably never even heard of. Our dynamic approach, combined with our fast-paced environment, sets us apart in the industry. We're not just here to meet expectations; we're here to exceed them, every single time. Our relentless pursuit of excellence has been the cornerstone of our continuous success.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are excited to be on the hunt for a talented and motivated individual to join our team as a Swedish Speaking Content Editor.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Edit and publish written content using WordPress
* Build content briefs across a range of topics with thorough keyword and competitor analysis
* Daily management of in-house or freelance writers, setting deadlines, giving feedback, and setting tasks
* Work closely with the regional Content Manager to manage priorities and workflow
* Review and edit existing content to ensure it meets the editorial standards and SEO guidelines
* Suggest new ideas and content types with data-backed research


**Qualifications**
* 3+ years of proven experience working with content related to Web3
* Excellent written and spoken skills in English and Swedish. Having an eye for detail is a must
* Familiarity with SEO tools like Google Search Console, Google Analytics, Ahrefs, SEMrush and SurferSEO
* Proficiency with SEO to the extent that allows for perfect content optimization
* Previous experience using a CMS (Content Management System) such as WordPress and basic knowledge of HTML is highly beneficial
* Excellent organizational and time-management skills


**Benefits & Rewards**
* A brilliant opportunity to grow your career & work with a fun, fast-paced & growing company, prepared to let you shine
* An entrepreneurial environment where you learn more every day (we more than welcome and support people with their own projects)
* Build an organization that continues to diversify its portfolio
* Personal responsibility with a ton of autonomy
* 33 free paid days
* An international team with over 35 nationalities
* Fully Remote working
* Additional benefits for permanent employees are available depending on the location


**What do we mean by "Fully Remote"**
 Clickout Media offers you an unparalleled working experience. We are registered in Malta, but you don't have to be. Wherever you are based, and whether you are employed, operate B2B, or are a career freelancer, we will always find a way to work with great people.
   

  

 Engaging with a worldwide workforce, ClickOut Media brings together world leading experts in the fields of Tech, SEO, Content and Product. Our remote approach gives absolute flexibility to our people and exemplifies our philosophy of autonomy and trust.
   

  

 Diversity is a given for us, and this unique approach allows us to deliver and have respect for the wide variety of people, experiences and cultures we bring together.
   

  

**Our Recruitment Process Is As Follows**
* Apply
* Have an introduction call with our recruitment team
* Have a technical interview
* Do a test


**Equal Opportunities**
 ClickOut Media is an equal opportunity employer welcoming applicants from all backgrounds.

title: SVP Group Business Controller
description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.
   

  

 We’re looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we’re searching for a
 **SVP Group Business Controller** 
 in our
 **Stockholm office** 
 – are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?
   

  

 The role
   

  

 You will have the opportunity to work in an interesting and varied role in the team responsible for Viaplay Group’s planning and forecasting processes, management reporting, business performance review process and development and governance of key financial systems. By balancing strategic vision, financial acumen, and operational management, the SVP Group Business Controller plays a pivotal role in shaping the company’s financial health and long-term success.
   

  

 This position combines operational and strategical capabilities with more complex analytical tasks.
   

  

 Strong communication skills are important as there are many different stakeholders within the Group Management as well as within the Finance function
   

  

**Key Responsibilities And Accountabilities**
* Ownership of the finance management framework from a Group Business Control perspective, leading the budgeting process and quarterly reviews, forecasting, long-term financial planning, analysing performance trends, and providing insights to guide executive decision-making.
* Coordination and consolidation of the local markets business performance, leading strategic initiatives and developing robust business cases.
* Speaking partner to business controllers and Legal entity controllers regarding e.g. CFM, forecasting process and reporting process related matters
* Responsible and accountable for all aspects of efficient cash and debt management.
* Collaborate with leadership to develop and implement strategies, evaluate investment opportunities, and drive initiatives to enhance profitability and efficiency.
* Monitor and control expenses, develop cost control measures, oversee profitability analysis, and conduct variance analysis to optimize cost structures and address discrepancies.
* Design and manage KPIs and metrics, oversee financial reporting and presentations for senior management, and ensure compliance with internal controls, policies, and regulations.
* Act as a trusted advisor to the CEO, CFO and other key executives, provide financial insights and risk assessments for strategic initiatives, and foster cross-functional collaboration to align financial objectives with business goals.
* Support investor relations efforts by contributing to earnings reports and financial communications.
* Lead and develop finance teams, promote a culture of continuous improvement and financial accountability, and mentor finance professionals to foster growth and development.
* Optimize financial processes and systems, implement technologies to enhance reporting and analysis, and drive automation and digitization of financial workflows for greater efficiency.


 What we’re looking for
   

  

 We understand you may feel confident ticking certain boxes more than others and that’s why we always keep an open mind in our recruitment process. But, in order to thrive in this role, we do believe you’ll have at least some experience in the following:
   

  

* +10 years progressive professional experience from Finance/Controller positions preferably in the media industry, with at least 5 years in a leadership role.
* Experience in a listed company is a must.
* Academic degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration or related field
* Proven track record in strategic financial planning, forecasting, and cost management.
* Expertise in financial planning & analysis (FP&A), budgeting, and variance analysis with strong understanding of accounting principles, regulatory compliance and risk management.
* Proficiency in financial management systems and ERP tools (e.g., SAP, Oracle); and advanced analytical and data modelling skills using tools like Excel, Power BI, or Tableau.
* Ability to translate financial data into actionable business insights, evaluate investment opportunities, align financial strategies with business goals, and solve problems with a focus on driving profitability and operational efficiency.
* Strong executive presence with excellent communication and presentation skills to convey financial insights.
* High integrity and ethical standards in managing financial operations, and adaptability with proactive decision-making in dynamic business environments.
* Robust leadership skills with the ability to lead and develop high-performing finance teams, drive change, promote process improvements, foster a culture of financial discipline, and collaborate cross-functionally at the executive level.
* Self-motivated with ability to develop new ways of doing things (improve processes, reporting etc)


 What we offer you
   

  

**We’ve got you covered!** 
 30 days of paid vacation every year, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.
   

  

**Your wellbeing matters.** 
 We provide you with various wellbeing initiatives including wellness allowance.
   

  

**A safe space to grow and up-skill.** 
 Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development.
   

  

**Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do** 
 . So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including series & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.
   

  

 Hit play today
   

  

 If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.
   

  

 Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

title: Product Owner Order to Cash, Solna
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
**Are you passion about everyday improvements and experience with SAP system and a financial background? Look here!**
 PostNord Group IT is looking for a
 **Product Owner** 
 for our Order To Cash product team where our focus area is order-to-cash development. A lot of exciting things are happening in our area due to an ongoing transformation journey where we recently have upgraded to SAP S/4 HANA and we are in the starting blocks of implementation of SAP BRIM (Billing and Revenue Innovation Management).
   

  

**About The Role**
 As Product Owner in Solution Area Finance, belonging to Group IT you will in collaboration with your team, be responsible to create the product roadmap and have a very good understanding of the business needs within Finance. To succeed you need to build strong relationships with key stakeholders to ensure that the team’s effort is aligned with overall strategy. This role demands a proactive and knowledgeable individual who will drive the solution topics within your SAP Order To Cash product team.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Take end-to-end ownership of the product with ultimate accountability for business and customer value delivered
* Work closely with stakeholders within the PostNord Group, but mainly within Finance
* Lead an agile team with software engineers, developers and solution architects to execute and deliver value
* Define and manage product backlog priorities, and strategically de-scope to achieve rapid feedback cycle
* Prioritize product backlog items and coordinate with other teams to deliver high-quality solutions


 ,
   

  

 We are looking for a curios driver who can gather, analyze and understand customer and business needs and understand impact against product backlog and impact on team.
   

  

**You Have Skills Such As**
* Good understanding of Finance processes especially Order-to-Cash, Record-to-Report and Purchase to Pay.
* Classic modules like SAP Sales and Distribution (SD), Logistics Execution (LE) and integrations with Materials Management (MM) and Finance and Controlling (FICO)
* BRIM modules like Convergent Invoicing (CI), Convergent Charging (CC), Contract Accounting (FI-CA), Subscription Order Management (SOM) and Convergent Mediation
* Previous experience of working as Product Owner/Product Manager.
* 3-5 years as a Product Owner or in a leadership role managing SAP solutions.
* Good stakeholder management and clear communication skills.
* Strong in planning, prioritizing, execution, and follow up together with a “can-do attitude”
* Able to work at all levels of the organization as well as part of virtual teams.
* English and at least one Nordic language in speech and writing


**We offer you**
* Flexible hybrid workplace with an open working climate.
* Good insurance and occupational pension conditions.
* Wellness allowance and access to office gym and swimming pool.
* Employee benefits through PostNord's own employee foundation PostNord Plus.
* Employment according to a collective agreement.


**We make everyday life easier**
 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region. We are accountable, brave and committed, effectively leading change regardless if we lead our self or others. We emphasize teamwork, sincerity and positive relationships in the workplace. We build on our success and learn from both colleagues and mistakes. People with different backgrounds work with us. You will therefore be part of a workplace with great diversity, which contributes to better results for the business. Visit us at
   

  

**Apply**
 What are you waiting for? Welcome with your application. Selection is ongoing, so apply as soon as possible. If you have any questions about the position please send an email to petra.wahlund@postnord.com. Note that we do not accept applications via email. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Nordic Brand Manager, Advanced Wound Care
description:
**About Us**
 Pioneering trusted medical solutions to improve the lives we touch: Convatec is a global medical products and technologies company, focused on solutions for the management of chronic conditions, with leading positions in advanced wound care, ostomy care, continence care, and infusion care. With around 10,000 colleagues, we provide our products and services in almost 100 countries, united by a promise to be forever caring. Our solutions provide a range of benefits, from infection prevention and protection of at-risk skin, to improved patient outcomes and reduced care costs. Convatec’s revenues in 2023 were over $2 billion. The company is a constituent of the FTSE 100 Index (LSE:CTEC). To learn more about Convatec, please visit http://www.convatecgroup.com
   

  

 We are guided by our five core values, that shape the way we work, every day: Improve Care, Deliver Results, Grow Together, Own It and Do What’s Right.
   

  

 At Convatec, we’re transforming our business for the better. Better products. Better ways of working. And better ways of delivering for our customers and each other. We’re aiming for nothing short of excellence. Join us on our journey to #ForeverCaring as a Nordic Brand Manager, AWC and you’ll do the same.
   

  

**About the role:**
 The role of the Nordic Brand Manager is to drive solution sales and brand awareness by getting a deep understanding of the market for the Advanced Wound Care product. You will deliver consistent, clear product messaging aligned with our global branding and strategy.
   

  

 The relevant person will have a focus on the designated brand area across the 4 Nordic markets. Further, the role will have a close link to the local home country, where you they will support with local marketing tasks, exhibitions etc. Each Nordic Brand Manager covers a brand area across the 4 Nordic countries and will work closely together.
   

  

 The Nordic Brand Manager will implement global strategies for local market execution.
   

  

 The AWC area is targeted towards highly skilled HCP’s (Doctors and Nurses).
   

  

**Main duties and responsibilities:**
* Delivers on the marketing strategy according to the global marketing plans
* Responsible for product launches, ensuring every relevant party involved to successful delivery e.g.; Sales teams, supply chain, finance, commercial, according to Global Marketing guidance
* Tracks campaign and launch effectiveness and secure the improvement of activities in ShowPad and PowerBi.
* Optimizes market communication on current products (e.g. arrange webinars with Key Opinion Leaders and create new communication pieces)
* Supports Tenders related to products, technical product information, evidence etc.
* Provides information and insight on the marketplace for AWC, competitors and market landscape to Nordic management.
* Monitors and analyses sales performance and market conditions, including customer needs and competitors, implements marketing plans
* Identifies and exploits new market opportunities
* Drives messaging to HCPs via email campaigns, LinkedIn and Facebook – You know your brand and the messages, and you work closely together with the Nordic Digital Brand Manager who has the overview of the platforms
* Organizes and executes congresses and events to ensure brand awareness and customer interaction.
* Takes part of the budget planning process
* Coordinates and executes product training support to all relevant sales teams, new starters
* Ensures effective relationships with global marketing departments and other internal functions – supply chain, legal, finance
* Drives and implements webinars in the Nordic markets, with external HCP speakers using On24 platform or Teams. You will work together with Nordic colleagues driving your brand area forward


**Main Contacts**
**Internal**
* You are part of the Nordic Marketing team that consists of Nordic Brand Managers, Nordic Clinical Brand Manager, Nordic Digital Brand Manager and Ass. Marketing Director
* Nordic Management team
* Global and local marketing teams
* Sales teams, field based and digital sales team in Nordics.
* Market Access team
* Commercial and finance team


**External**
* Creative Agencies
* Translation agency
* Consultants, such as On24 support team
* Customers / KOL’s together with Product Specialists


**Travel Requirements**
 20% - 25%, on occasion, as business needs require minimal overnight stays, i.e., sales conferences, national or international congresses, team meetings.
   

  

**Language Skills:**
 Local Nordic language (DK or SE or FI or NO) fluent – writing/ reading and speaking, able to proofread texts
   

  

 This role requires Swedish or Norwegian.
   

  

 English fluent – writing / reading and speaking
   

  

**Education/Qualifications**
**Required:**
* Master or bachelor’s in marketing, business economics or administration
* Mastery of core marketing principles including brand development and positioning, implementation of global campaigns
* Knowledge of medical device (ideally the Advanced Wound Care market) and/ or pharmaceutical industries
* General marketing and sales experience in medical device industry, preferably from AWC
* Strong analytical mindset and very good excel skills


**Main Requirements/Experience**
* Strong marketing mindset
* Experienced in managing local market and key customer groups, understanding how to meet customer needs in the new digital space after Covid19
* Preferably brings knowledge of different tools, e.g. Optimizely, ShowPad, PowerBi, ON24
* Successful development of product/service marketing strategies and implementation of marketing plans/ campaigns by use of multiple channels
* In depth knowledge in planning and organizing meetings, congresses, and exhibitions
* Strong analytical skills, good written and verbal communication competencies, able to analyze and interpret data to support decision making and leverage 360 dialogue
* Presentation expertise to local and global management levels
* Strong project management skills to deliver on tight deadlines and manage complex interdisciplinary project teams
* Understanding of technical operations, supply chain, finance, and sales
* Ability to work independently and communicate
* Takes own responsibility and drives the business forward
* Commercial awareness and understanding of business priorities
* High drive and motivation for creating change and innovative ideas
* Demonstrates self-confidence when dealing with complex processes
* Acts with sensitivity and empathy in dialogue with internal and external customers and stakeholders
* Processes strong interpersonal skills to build and maintain strong relationships both internally and externally
* Able to plan and balance several marketing related requirements
* Exercises a high degree of adaptability in dealing with complex, dynamic work environment


**Working Conditions**
 National legislation / full week working time
   

  

 Working environment is office based with home office possibility and partial travel.
   

  

 Our transformation will change your career. For good. You’ll be pushed to think bigger and aim for excellence. Your ideas will be heard, and you’ll be supported to bring them to life. There’ll be challenges. But stretch yourself and embrace the opportunities, and you could make your biggest impact yet. This is stepping outside of your comfort zone. This is work that’ll move you.
   

  

**Beware of scams online or from individuals claiming to represent Convatec**
 A formal recruitment process is required for all our opportunities prior to any offer of employment. This will include an interview confirmed by an official Convatec email address.
   

  

 If you receive a suspicious approach over social media, text message, email or phone call about recruitment at Convatec, do not disclose any personal information or pay any fees whatsoever. If you’re unsure, please contact us at careers@Convatec.com.
   

  

**Equal opportunities**
 Convatec provides equal employment opportunities for all current employees and applicants for employment. This policy means that no one will be discriminated against because of race, religion, creed, color, national origin, nationality, citizenship, ancestry, sex, age, marital status, physical or mental disability, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, genetic predisposing characteristics or any other basis prohibited by law.
   

  

**Notice to Agency and Search Firm Representatives**
 Convatec is not accepting unsolicited resumes from agencies and/or search firms for this job posting. Resumes submitted to any Convatec employee by a third party agency and/or search firm without a valid written and signed search agreement, will become the sole property of Convatec. No fee will be paid if a candidate is hired for this position as a result of an unsolicited agency or search firm referral. Thank you.
   

  

**Already a Convatec employee?**
**If you are an active employee at Convatec, please do not apply here. Go to the Career Worklet on your Workday home page and View "Convatec Internal Career Site - Find Jobs". Thank you!**

title: Linux/Unix-specialist
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Vår konsultorganisation behöver förstärka med fler Linux/Unix-specialister med god kunskap och erfarenhet inom områdets samtliga delar.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som vill följa med på en spännande resa framåt och få möjligheten att växa med ett globalt företag som är marknadsledande inom den svenska IT-marknaden. Hos oss får du arbeta i spännande projekt och uppdrag, vi utlovar inspirerande arbetsuppgifter och utveckling.
   

  

 Du kommer vara en del av en konsultgrupp med olika specialiteter för att kunna ge våra kunder den bästa leveransen och bred service. Du kommer att få delta i spännande och stimulerande samarbeten med kollegor på CGI och medarbetare hos våra kunder.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Som Linux/Unix-specialist består ditt dagliga arbete av att säkerställa, utveckla och förvalta våra kunders infrastruktur. Det kan handla om allt från planering, design, drift, rådgivning, strategisk utveckling, implementation, övervakning, felsökning och mycket mer.
   

  

 Arbetet kan utföras hos kund i Stockholm eller på något av CGI´s kontor i Stockholm.
   

  

 Vi arbetar både enskilt och tillsammans med kollegor i våra projekt och söker engagerade medarbetare som tar initiativ, inspirerar, bygger relationer och levererar lösningar med en helhetssyn.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Vi vill att du har minst 3 års erfarenhet av att jobba operativt med IT-infrastruktur.
   

  

 Vi önskar att du har:
   

  

* Stort intresse av att arbeta operativt inom IT-området på bredden, men också på djupet inom valda områden
* Stor kunskap och erfarenhet av Linux, Unix, AIX och/eller Ubuntu
* Erfarenhet av att jobba med incidenthantering och felsökning
* Kunskap om driftsrelaterade processer(ITIL)
* Kan bidra till referensarkitektur för serverlösa funktioner, säkerhet etc
* Har goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift
* Har svenskt medborgarskap då det kan vara aktuelllt med säkerhetsklassad arbete och säkerhetsprövning kan förekomma


 För att bli framgångsrik och trivas i jobbet krävs det att du har ett stort tekniskt intresse och god förståelse för infrastruktur och tillgänglighet. Som person är du nyfiken, driven och konsultmässig.
   

  

 Du har god samarbetsförmåga och ett organiserat arbetssätt. Rollen passar dig som trivs med struktur, att arbeta med stort kundfokus, har en positiv inställning och motiveras av att driva på och se resultat i ditt arbete. Vi tror även att du alltid har en affärsmässig inställning och är kreativ i din problemlösningsförmåga.
   

  

**Vill du veta mer?**
 Har du frågor om jobbet kontakta rekryterande ledare Marcus Gridange, marcus.grindange@cgi.com. Vi tillämpar löpande urval skicka därför in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.
   

  

 Som anställd erbjuds du nedan förmåner:
   

  

* Föräldralön: Vi betalar upp till cirka 90% av din lön under den första tiden hemma.
* Aktieprogram och delägarskap: Som delägare har du möjlighet att påverka och i vårt aktieprogram matchar CGI ditt bidrag, krona för krona upp till 3% av din månadslön.
* Friskvårdsbidrag: Vi erbjuder ett årligt friskvårdsbidrag på 4 000 kr.
* Trygg anställning: Våra medlemmar anställs med kollektivavtal och försäkringar.
* Pensionslösningar: Vi erbjuder attraktiva och förmånliga pensionslösningar.
* Personalbil: Personalbilen används som en privatbil men leasas av CGI.


**Övrigt: Bakgrundskontroller och registerkontroll kan komma att genomföras om uppdraget kräver det.**
**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Summer Work at Scania Södertälje 2025
description:
*Are you looking for an exciting opportunity to gain hands-on experience, develop your skills, and make the most of your summer? Look no further! Scania offers a range of summer job positions for enthusiastic and motivated students.*
**About Us**
 Scania is transforming from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – Customer First, Respect, Team Spirit, Responsibility, and Elimination of Waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

**Available Positions**
 We have various summer job openings in different departments. When applying for a summer job this year, you can choose one area that interests you, depending on your educational level.
   

  

 If you study in high school, college, or university you are welcome to apply for our summer jobs within:
   

  

  

* Administration
* Logistics – Note that you must be 18 years of age to work in this field
* Production - Note that you must be 18 years of age to work in this field
* Service


 If you study at college or university you are welcome to apply for our summer jobs within:
   

  

  

* Economics and Finance
* IT
* Procurement
* Research and Development


 You can read more about the different areas here Summer job in Södertälje | Scania Group
   

  

**What We Offer**
**Global Leader:** 
 Scania is a world-renowned company in the automotive industry, known for its innovative solutions. Work with a global leader in sustainable transport solutions, shaping the future of mobility and transportation.
   

  

**Professional Growth:** 
 We pride ourselves on creating an inclusive and dynamic work environment where employees are encouraged to grow personally and professionally. Gain invaluable experience and skills that will set you apart in your future career. You also get the opportunity to make valuable contacts and find references for future thesis work.
   

  

**Supportive Environment:** 
 Work alongside a team of experienced professionals who are passionate about what they do and eager to help you succeed.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 Submit your application by answering our selection questions and attaching your resume and a cover letter detailing your interest and qualifications for the role.
   

  

 Our recruitment system selects candidates based on the competencies written in the resume (CV) and cover letter. It matches those to the requirements the managers have specified for their specific summer job.
   

  

 It is therefore important to write every competence you possess – both formal and informal. It can, for example, mean that you write the software tools, and programming languages you are studying or have studied, but also soft skills like if you are service-minded or possess leadership skills, etc.
   

  

 We perform background checks on the candidates we aim to hire.
   

  

 The recruitment is ongoing – to have a better chance of getting a summer job, apply as soon as possible!
 **Applications should be submitted by March 2nd, 2025** 
 .
   

  

 Join us and make this summer a stepping stone to your successful career!

title: Data Engineer
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Du kommer att bli en del i ett av CGI:s Data Insights team i stockholm, dvs ett av CGI:s analytics team som arbetar med att hjälpa våra kunder att bygga, förvalta och hantera dataplattformar (DW:n, Lakehouses m.m.) och BI lösningar. Vi befinner oss i en tillväxtfas och ska förstärka vårt team inom BI & Analytics i Stockholm.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Vi önskar arbeta i teknikens framkant med utmanande uppdrag och vårt mål är att accelerera vår position inom området. Förutom att bli en del i ett av våra vassa team, så erbjuder vi goda möjligheter till att påverka och utforma din roll för att uppnå maximal utveckling.
   

  

 I rollen som Data Engineer kommer du arbeta i ett team där du har möjlighet att jobba med allt ifrån traditionella data warehouse-utveckling, både on-prem men mer och mer i en cloudmiljö, till mer avancerad analys och arkitekturfrågor.
   

  

 Vi samarbetar med stora erkända partners såsom Microsoft, Qlik, Google och Snowflake.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet i något av följande områden:
   

  

* DW resp Lakehouse-arkitektur,
* SQL, Python, Spark, Powershellscripts etc.
* MS Azure (Synapse, Data Factory etc.)
* MS Fabric


 Det är också meriterande om du har:
   

  

* Kunskap inom: Databricks, DBT, Snowflake, GCP
* Power BI, Qlik
* 5+ års erfarenhet
* Tidigare konsulterfarenhet
* En högskoleexamen inom IT, systemvetenskap eller Civilingenjörsexamen


 Som person delar du med dig av din kunskap, är ödmjuk, lätt att samarbeta med. Du tar egna initiativ och är en självgående, utåtriktad och affärsmässig lagspelare som vill arbeta med människor och teknik. Vi förutsätter att du behärskar svenska och engelska bra i såväl tal som skrift.
   

  

**Vill du veta mer?**
 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig! Om det finns något du undrar över, skicka gärna dina funderingar till rekryterande ledare/Konsultchef Christian Carlborg, på christian.carlborg@cgi.com
   

  

 Mer information om våra förmåner:
   

  

* Aktieprogram och delägarskap: Som delägare har du möjlighet att påverka och i vårt aktieprogram matchar CGI ditt bidrag, krona för krona upp till 3% av din månadslön.
* Friskvårdsbidrag: Vi erbjuder ett årligt friskvårdsbidrag på 4 000 kr.
* Föräldralön: Vi betalar upp till cirka 90% av din lön under den första tiden hemma.
* Trygg anställning: Våra konsulter anställs med kollektivavtal och försäkringar.
* Pensionslösningar: Vi erbjuder attraktiva och förmånliga pensionslösningar.
* Personalbil: Personalbilen används som en privatbil men leasas av CGI.


  
   

  

**Om oss**
 CGI är det största konsultbolaget inom digitalisering och verksamhetsutveckling i Göteborg med en global organisation i ryggen.
   

  

 Vår företagskultur präglas av uppmuntran, samarbete och medmänsklighet. Det är högt i tak och finns alltid utrymme för att fånga upp och lyfta initiativ och nya idéer. Vi tror på att mångfald gör oss mer effektiva och kreativa och arbetar aktivt med frågan, varje dag. Vårt team består av affärsmässiga lagspelare som vill arbeta med människor och teknik. För att du ska trivas hos oss behöver du vara en person som tar egna initiativ och ser det som självklart att dela med dig av kunskap för att få andra och även dig själv att växa och utvecklas.
   

  

 Med våra gedigna kunskaper hjälper vi kunder inom såväl privat som offentlig sektor med att möta deras utmaningar på bästa tänkbara sätt. Vi som jobbar här har höga ambitioner och vi brinner vi för kreativa lösningar. Om du delar vår dröm: "Att skapa en miljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans, och som ägare, bidra till att bygga ett företag som vi kan vara stolta över", då är det dig vi söker!
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: BI Developer
description:
Assignment description:
   

  

 The Data & Analytics (D&A) team is in the process of migrating their current Data Warehouse to a Data Lakehouse. We need a BI Developer to support assessing the current workloads and data, then support the migration.
   

  

 The current Data Warehouse was built 15 years ago for Financial Reporting. Since then, the scope of the application has expanded to providing reports to the whole organization with some operational processes supported as well. The Data Warehouse has been built using Microsoft technologies, both on-prem and Cloud based.
   

  

**Migration work includes:**
* Logically mapping the current Data Warehouse.
* Modelling the existing Data Warehouse and Data Marts.
* Migrating existing reporting solutions.
* Decommissioning the remaining reporting solutions


**Technical platforms we work with include:**
 Microsoft BI Stack (Power BI, SQL Server, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS), Azure (Data Factory, Functions, DevOps, etc.), and tools like Visual Studio and Redgate.
   

  

****To be successful in this role you have:****
* An experienced BI Developer who has been working with the Azure technology stack for at least five years.
* Experience in technical roles within cloud and data environments.
* Hands-on experience with best practices in implementing data-driven solutions using Azure and big data technologies.
* Proficiency in data modelling, ETL processes, and data warehouse concepts.
* Familiarity with Azure DevOps and Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools such as Terraform.


**Estimated Workload:** 
 100%
   

  

**Working Language: English/Swedish**
*We offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before deadline. If you are interested we recommend that you apply immediately.*

title: Systemutvecklare
description:
B3 Link, en del av B3-koncernen, utmärker oss genom vår djupa systemutvecklingskompetens och förmåga att leverera kompletta lösningar för våra kunder. Vi kombinerar även avancerad AI-teknik med en förståelse för affärsbehov och tar ansvar för hela utvecklingsprocessen. Vår styrka ligger i att skapa hållbara och skalbara lösningar som stödjer kundens verksamhet och långsiktiga mål.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Teamet i Stockholm/Uppsala består av ett gäng kollegor med kompetens inom både backend, frontend och fullstack, vilka nu söker sin nästa kollega! Att vara konsult på B3 Link innebär att du hjälper våra kunder i deras utvecklingsprojekt och dagliga utmaningar.
   

  

**Vi letar efter dig som har:**
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet inom systemutveckling Java, .Net eller Python
* Arbetat med cloud-teknologier
* Arbetat med microservices
* God svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


**Extra glada blir vi om du har:**
* Erfarenhet av DevOps
* Erfarenhet av moderna frontend-ramverk
* Intresse av AI teknik


**Vad vi erbjuder:**
 Att vi trivs tillsammans på B3 Link är otroligt viktigt. Anledningen till att många börjar hos oss är bland annat det stora fokuset på
 **kompetensutveckling** 
 , där vi kontinuerligt delar kunskap med varandra och uppmuntrar till kompetensutveckling och certifieringar. Vi erbjuder bland annat:
   

  

* Generös kompetensutveckling
* Attraktiv lönemodell
* En fantastisk wellness- och medarbetarsatsning


**Om B3**
 B3 Link är en del av B3-koncernen. B3 är en börsnoterad koncern och trygg arbetsgivare med hög medarbetarnöjdhet. B3 har ca 1000 medarbetare inom många olika expertområden. B3 är rankad som Sveriges tredje bästa arbetsplats 2021 av Great Place to Work, utsett till Sveriges IT Karriärföretag 2022 och 2023, samt vann utmärkelsen Årets Karriärföretag 2022. Vi lever efter våra värdeord erfarenhet, olikheter och energi samt satsar på hållbarhet i alla led. Vi tror att medarbetare som mår bra presterar bättre och har därför B3 Team som anordnar aktiviteter inom wellness, från yoga och löpning till musikquiz och föreläsningar om stresshantering och mental hälsa."
   

  

**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan redan idag!**
 Har du frågor om tjänsten? Tveka inte att kontakta rekryteringsansvarig för denna tjänst, Petra Magnusson, på petra.magnusson@b3.se

title: Analytics Lead, Merchant
description:
**Job Description**
 We are looking for an
 **Analytics Lead** 
 to join Wolt’s
 **Merchant** 
 mission in
 **Helsinki or Stockholm** 
 !
   

  

**About The Role**
 As an Analytics Lead at Wolt, you’ll take charge of the Merchant Ops Team, balancing hands-on analytics work with people management responsibilities. Experience in Product and Operations would be a significant advantage. In Wolt’s fast-paced, three-sided marketplace, you’ll find a demanding yet rewarding environment to hone your modern analytics skills.
   

  

**You will have the opportunity to…**
* Lead and grow a team of talented data scientists
* Set the strategic direction for all analytical work within the Merchant domain
* Establish a solid experimentation culture with your Product and operational stakeholders
* Coach your team and participate hands-on in developing new metrics for the business
* This role combines scientific expertise with stakeholder engagement, placing you at the forefront of driving business outcomes. You will collaborate closely with the Product, Engineering, Design, and Operations teams to guide measurement strategies and tactical decisions, helping to expand the Wolt platform globally.


 If you enjoy finding patterns amidst chaos, are excited to build a team and solutions from the ground up, and have a proven track record in using data science to solve business problems, we want you on our team. Take ownership of business outcomes and proactively drive change with Wolt!
   

  

**Our offering to you**
* The online delivery platform that Wolt is building will offer you interesting and complex challenges together with the opportunities to create a big impact with your skills. Lots of geolocational and temporal data in real-time combined with differences in the economics and dynamics of the cities we operate in make Wolt both a challenging and so interesting company to practice analytics.
* You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognize that if we don’t learn, we won’t stay still but fall behind. Read more about how we work.
* Uncover foundational causal relationships in our data that can help us understand our business.
* Drive strategic decision-making within the whole Merchant Group.


**Our humble expectations**
* Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field
* Have 5+ years of experience in a data science or analytics position within an industry or research setting
* Have 2+ years of experience in team leadership within an industry or research setting, with the ability to inspire, motivate, and influence cross-functional teams to achieve organizational goals and deliver exceptional results.
* Expertise in statistical analysis, including hypothesis testing, experimentation, and regression analysis using statistical software packages in Python, Matlab, R, or equivalent
* Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets
* Relentless pursuit of new ideas and data sources, and have the ability to systematically tackle ambiguous problems with a data-driven, hypothesis-based approach
* Be analytical, inquisitive, and a self-starter who is motivated to achieve results and collaborate with colleagues both inside and outside of the team


**Next Steps**
 The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!
   

  

 The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.
   

  

 For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Zhanna Filintseva (zhanna.filintseva@wolt.com)
   

  

**About Wolt**
 Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to your home or office. Wolt is not just a delivery app – we’re a technology company building a commerce platform to seamlessly connect our millions of customers with thousands of merchant and courier partners, in real-time across 23 countries and 250+ cities. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry’s highest ratings, largely thanks to our customer-first-mindset, which shows in how we build products and run operations. In June 2022 we officially joined forces with DoorDash. Combined, we have a presence in 27 countries, 23 of which operate with the Wolt brand and app. Wolt and DoorDash continue largely independently, with Wolt’s name, brand, product, technology and team.
   

  

**Working in Product Development at Wolt**
 At Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.
   

  

 The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 400+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 40 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.
   

  

**Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion**
 We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.
   

  

 Join us today to build Wolt together!

title: Data Engineer
description:
Om tjänsten
   

  

 At Vattenfall, we don’t just “do energy”, we exist to help our customers power their lives in ever climate smarter ways and enable fossil freedom. If you are looking for exciting challenges and the opportunity to be part of this change, then join our diverse and talented team and make a difference!
   

  

 The future is data-driven! Do you agree and want to be part of accelerating Vattenfall’s digital transformation in the area of energy markets? Then we have just the right position for you! For our office in Stockholm or Hamburg we are looking for a Data Engineer to join our Structuring & Valuation team.
   

  

**The job**
 As a Data Engineer you will work in a multidisciplinary team which develops and maintains models and processes used for the automated pricing of energy customers and forward curves. Having well-organized data and robust models is essential given analytical content and business impact. We offer an exciting and challenging job where you work close to the business as well as with state-of-the-art technology. This role offers a mix of IT tasks and analytical tasks, allowing you to learn best practices for handling large amounts of data and gain valuable insights about the energy market.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* DATA: Make sure that our data is available in a format suitable for our pricing models by building, running and monitoring data pipelines using Apache Airflow. Take ownership of the data and work actively with data quality
* COOP: Collaborate with stakeholders and subject matter experts to make sure our models and processes are up-to-date and are fulfilling business needs
* MODELS: Contribute to the continuous improvement of our Python models in a collaborative setting using Azure DevOps and Git
* LEARN: You will work with energy market and modelling experts, and you will have the opportunity to learn from the best!


 Din bakgrund
   

  

**We believe you have**
* Interest and preferably experience in data engineering projects, including cloud-based data pipelines and deployment of models and tools to run in production
* A curious and analytical mindset, you will work in a team of Analysts and need to understand the underlying mathematical modeling of the product and have a genuine interest of what drives the business value
* Strong communication skills and the willingness to frequently and directly interact with analysts, IT, front office and other data-driven departments
* Proficient knowledge in Python Programming
* Basic familiarity in Git, Airflow, Kafka, and Azure and eagerness to learn and work with these tools on a daily basis
* An Academic degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics, physics or similar
* Fluent in English. Swedish, German or Dutch language skills are an advantage
* Some experience or interest in the Energy business or financial markets is beneficial


 Mer information
   

  

**We offer**
* A welcoming work climate with flat hierarchies, appreciation for own initiative, open discussion culture and zero-tolerance for harassment.
* An international and multi-cultural work environment with energetic colleagues.
* A dynamic and challenging working environment where constantly changing markets translate to evolving customer requirements.
* Being part of the Analysis community, where we eagerly share knowledge and ideas regarding a wide range analytical topics relevant to the electricity market
* A flexible and supportive work culture, in an Agile setting without micro-management, where you as a team are trusted to be the specialists on how to do your work.
* Opportunities and support for professional growth. For example, the encouragement to do internal rotations to broaden your horizon.
* Flexible working hours, including working remotely up to half of the time per week.


**More information**
**Location:** 
 Stockholm and Hamburg with partly remote work permitted.
   

  

**Contract type:** 
 Permanent (after 6 months of probation).
   

  

 We welcome your application in English, no later than
 **February 22nd, 2025** 
 . We kindly request that you do not send applications by any means other than via our website as we cannot guarantee that we will be able to process applications that are not made via our website.
   

  

 For more information about the recruitment process you are welcome to contact our Recruiter
 **Jil Ungethüm** 
 via phone at +49 40 79022 1378.
   

  

 At Vattenfall we are convinced that diversity contributes to build a more profitable and attractive company and we strive to be good role model regarding diversity. Vattenfall works actively for all employees to have the same opportunities and rights regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, transgender identity or expression, religion or other belief, disability or sexual orientation.
   

  

 The security of Vattenfall and its employees is essential. For that reason, a pre-employment screening will be part of your recruitment process. The screening is based on the role you will fulfill within Vattenfall. The screening will be performed by a third party, called Validata. In addition, a certificate of good conduct (i.e. criminal record certificate) is required for certain positions.
   

  

 The trade union representatives in Sweden can be reached via Vattenfall´s switchboard +46 8 739 50 00. Sven-Gunnar Gremlin, Akademikerna and Anders Bohlin, Unionen.
   

  

 Since Vattenfall is a part of the Swedish critical infrastructure, many of our services are security classed. If this position is security classed the final candidates might be subjected to a security vetting process, according to the Swedish legislation.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**
 Om oss
   

  

**Vattenfall** 
 is a European energy company with approximately 21 000 employees. For more than 100 years we have electrified industries, supplied energy to people’s homes and modernized our way of living through innovation and cooperation. To be able to reach this ambitious goal we are looking for talented individuals who, in addition to their passion for their own role, also have strong team spirit and want to contribute to supporting a meaningful corporate mission.
   

  

**Business Area (BA) Markets’** 
 role in Vattenfall is to maximize the value of the overall portfolio by optimizing and dispatching, hedging and sourcing for Vattenfall's sales and generation volumes. We serve as Vattenfall’s single access to energy commodity markets and trade electricity, emissions, fuels, freight, and renewable certificates. We employ around 500 professionals who are active across Europe with offices in Sweden, Germany, The Netherlands and the United Kingdom.
   

  

 In BA Markets the mission of the
 **Unit OU Operations** 
 is to drive the digital transformation. OU Operations consists of diverse and highly skilled employees from more than 20 countries. We work internationally from our locations in Stockholm, Hamburg and Amsterdam.
   

  

 We have a culture of care and growth. You will collaborate with inspiring people around you, on complex and interesting topics. Together, we drive the energy transition and contribute to a journey towards becoming fossil-free.

title: Business Intelligence Consultant & Power BI Developer
description:
B3 Elevate söker nu fler konsulter inom Business Intelligence och Power BI som vill arbeta i spännande team- och expertuppdrag hos våra klienter i projekt och förvaltning. Vi upplever nu en stark efterfrågan på stöd ifrån duktiga BI-konsulter inom strategi och utveckling av moderna analyticslösningar. Vårt team består av teknik- och verksamhetsexperter inom Power Platform som tillsammans bistår vid digital transformation med stöd från Dynamics 365 och Power BI. Hos oss får du möjlighet att utveckla dina kunskaper om den senaste tekniken inom Microsoft-plattformen och vara en nyckelspelare i att hjälpa våra kunder bli mer datadrivna.
   

  

**Möjliga uppdrag**
 Våra konsulter har möjlighet att arbeta både inom strategi och implementering, antingen via:
   

  

* Teamleverans vid nyutveckling av ny plattform där vi tar ansvar för att leverera en helhetslösning från förstudie till lansering
* Förvaltningsuppdrag där vi arbetar agilt med att förbättra rapporter och stödja organisationer att arbeta mer datadrivet


 Båda typer av uppdrag ger möjligheten för konsulten att samarbeta nära kund och med duktiga kollegor samtidigt som man självständigt får arbeta hands-on med framtidens analytics-lösningar
   

  

**Din roll**
 Som konsult på B3 Elevate ingår man i ett starkt team av experter som arbetar med hela Microsoft Power Platform. Du kommer att agera expert i leveranser av högkvalitativa datadrivna lösningar med ansvarsområden som sträcker sig från kravarbete till insamling och struktur av data till konfigurering av färdiga lösningar med visuella rapporter och dashboards i Power BI, samt utbildning av användare. Som BI-konsult får man arbeta brett, med olika datakällor men oftast med data från Dynamics 365. Din roll är att säkerställa att våra kunder kan ta välgrundade affärsbeslut baserade på data.
   

  

**Erfarenhet och kompetens**
 Vi söker dig som gillar att ta stort ansvar, exponeras för olika tekniska och affärsmässiga utmaningar, och som trivs med att jobba från idé till färdig implementering. Vi tror att du har några års erfarenhet som konsult och är van vid att arbeta med affärsdrivande data och teknik. Du har kanske en bakgrund inom ekonomi, verksamhetsanalys, Business Intelligence eller liknande, och du känner dig bekväm med att förstå både siffror och teknikens roll i affärsutveckling. Du är en konsultmässig lagspelare med förmåga att översätta data till konkreta insikter och beslut som skapar affärsnytta för våra kunder. Du trivs i en miljö där du får jobba nära både tekniska lösningar och kundens affär.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen ser vi gärna att du har:**
* Flera års erfarenhet av Power BI
* Goda teknikkunskaper och förmåga att lösa tekniska problem
* Erfarenhet från Azure, Dataverse eller Fabric
* God förståelse för informations- och datamodellering
* Erfarenhet från andra BI-verktyg (t.ex. Tableau/Qlik)
* Kunskap om SQL (ej krav)
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska


**Vårt erbjudande**
 B3 Elevate är ett specialistbolag för Power Platform och Dynamics 365 inom B3 Consulting Group med 20+ konsulter och förmåga att leverera digital transformation från strategi, via projekt och till förvaltning. Vi erbjuder hög beläggning, stor möjlighet till utveckling och inflytande - både över de lösningar som vi utvecklar samt bolagets riktning. Som Power BI-utvecklare hos oss får du tillgång till ett internt forum där våra BI-konsulter kontinuerligt utbyter erfarenheter och löser frågeställningar tillsammans.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder en attraktiv lönemodell, stora utvecklingsmöjligheter och härliga kollegor. Du kommer att ha goda förutsättningar att anpassa dina arbetstider för att uppnå balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Vi ingår i B3 som är en börsnoterad koncern och trygg arbetsgivare med hög medarbetarnöjdhet som är känd för sina operativa och leveranssäkra IT- och management-konsulter. B3 har över 1000 konsulter inom olika expertområden och orter, samt huvudkontor i nya lokaler vid Hötorget.

title: Manager - Stockholm | BCG Platinion
description:
As a Manager at BCG Platinion in the Nordics, you are responsible for the execution and management of our national and international client projects. We collaborate with colleagues from BCG Platinion and/or the Boston Consulting Group on site and directly with the client company.
   

  

 The Manager role incorporates structuring the project and performing the required resource planning. Besides the functional navigation of the project members, you will also be involved operationally in the project business. Together with our clients, you will develop convincing IT strategies, concepts and solutions, applying technical know-how and extensive experience in structuring IT projects, just as analytical and conceptual skills. We independently support our clients, present our results to their decision makers, and agree on the next steps.
   

  

 Shape the world of tomorrow
   

  

* Independently contribute to build close client relationships - and as their trusted advisor, you are the first to whom they turn
* Acquire new projects and challenges for our company and yourself
* Be in charge of planning, leading, and assuring quality for strategic IT projects - we work with passion for our clients' long-term success
* Get to use your comprehensive knowledge of technology and industry understanding to provide both internal and external stakeholders with the orientation they need in critical project phases and challenging situations
* Think across projects and connecting factors, and plan resources to achieve the best efficiency possible
* Take ownership for presenting key project results at the highest level of client management
* Work with an entrepreneurial approach and passion to advance BCG Platinion with your contributions to people development, recruiting, and practice areas


 You can help us make a difference if you
   

  

* bring a completed a degree in computer science, (business) informatics, or a related area with above-average grades
* have at least eight years of substantial experience in IT consulting and the lead design and management of IT strategy and implementation projects
* already captured project-related management experience as the lead of teams with more than five people
* know how to plan IT initiatives and build solid business cases
* optimally steer decisions towards the goal and master escalating situations with an eye to solutions - even in complex organizational structures
* have successfully acquired consulting projects
* are excellent at understanding and communicating complex topics in English
